108001.name: Combat Mission: Afghanistan
108001.description:
Russian software developer Snowball made a surprise announcement that they were developing a game under license using the CMx2 game engine, with certain refinements and additions, in order to portray tactical combat during the Soviet war in Afghanistan during 1979-1989. Battlefront confirmed the news on their official website and posted screenshots of some of the work in progress, confirming that playable units would include Lee-Enfield-armed mujahadeen, BMP personnel carriers, and other authentic military equipment emblematic of the era.

Source: Wikipedia, "Combat Mission (computer game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108002.name: South Surfers
108002.description:
Welcome to South Surfing Park!

This is a real sea

You can enjoy amazing experiences from the calm waves to those at dizzy height that might flip your mind. Let’s face the sea waves fluctuating up and down so vigorously and enormously breaking.

Enjoy as you as you can in Water Park

The ocean wave pool is gigantic and the wide river run down very fast. You can have them all at the same time. It’s like sea water running in a brook.

Easy control but real surfing

When you turn around a cellular phone, then it Surfing Board also turns around. The gravity sensor of the phone makes you feel like surfing on real waves.One more thing! Shake (Or Touch) the screen and you will jump up. These two controls are all you need to do.

Go faster and jump higher be a professional surfer.

You can make a new record by performing 10 aerial turns in a row, eating ice and jumping and surfing skills. There is no limit to records.

Look sharp!

The water gets tougher and the waves push the board faster.
Once absent-minded, the waves invade up to the top of your head instead of yourself.

Real Physics Engine

We are using 3D Physics Engine. For calculate buoyancy and gravity real time!

Listen your own music

You can use your music file to background music! Set BGM OFF and play music (from your phone) something like cool reggae,surfing rock,dance or anything

Source: The Developer Website.

108004.name: Paper Zombie
108004.description:
User Summary

This time the threat is made of paper...

Survive wave after wave of pulp terror using a quick finger and your trusty box cutter. Shred the paper zombies and assist survivors as they seek shelter.

108005.name: Wizard
108005.description:
Electronic game which Waddingtons probably saw as a competitor to take on Milton Bradley's Simon.

It plays 4 different games - Match Me, Break Out, Hot Corners and Music Maker. The main game was Match Me which was nearly an exact copy of the Simon game. Each game had 11 different ways to play them. The game has sound and moving lights.

108006.name: Trivial Pursuit: Food & Drink – Bite-Size
108006.description:
Trivial Pursuit Bite Size ... Our favourite game now doesn't take a day to play! You can ask and answer 600 questions about ingredients, fast food, techniques and utensils, fine dining, drinks and world food.

This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

For 2 or more players.

108007.name: Мисс Русская ночь
108007.description:
From publisher:

Miss Russian Night (How many women can you seduce in one night?) is a card board game that has been produced under license with the erotic Russian Night TV channel. The players are the guests at a night club who are flirting with 8 different girls. The winner is the player who is able to successfully lure the most women to bed.

Each girl is a real model from the TV channel. They are represented by ten different cards, all varying in their level of intimacy from the proper “one” whom a player can eventually get, to the absolutely naked “ten”. The playing field has three different zones: a stack of cards at the dance floor, the bar table with four open cards and the strip podium. The winner of the game will be the one who can control his desires and use his skills

108008.name: Batman Returns (SNES)
108008.description:
The SNES version of the game was released in 1993. It is fundamentally a left-to-right scrolling fighter beat-em-up, a genre that featured heavily on the console at the time. The gameplay and graphics are very similar to the Final Fight games.

The game takes the player through seven scenes featured in the film. Various members of the Red Triangle Circus Gang attack Batman throughout the game. Batman has a number of weapons and moves at his disposal, including the batarang. Each level ends with a boss character, which requires a little more effort and strategy to defeat. A number of levels are two-dimensional platform levels as opposed to the majority of the pseudo-3D levels where freer movement is permitted. The fifth level consists of driving the Batmobile in a chase scene where Batman must chase bikers and a heavily-armed van from the gang. In order to defeat them, the Batmobile uses a machine gun.

Reviews of the game were largely positive, although some criticism was made about the lack of originality. Praise was gained for the quality of the graphics, sound, fluid controls, balanced difficulty level and atmosphere (with music adapted from Danny Elfman's score for the film).

Batman Returns was awarded Best Licensed Game of 1992 by Electronic Gaming Monthly.

Source: Wikipedia, "Batman Returns (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108009.name: Боец
108009.description:
From publisher:

The card game duel The Fighter (Men can do anything!) has been created based on the popular Russian reality-show about mixed martial arts: M1-Fighter. Now, anyone can step into the ring and participate in fights with their TV heroes! Swings and uppercuts, throws and low-kicks, holds and yellow cards – this original fight simulator contains all those elements which we love to see in the martial arts. The game presents eight fighters: actual participants from the TV show. They all have unique fighting abilities: strength, speed, stamina and coordination. Using their skills, the fighters attack each other, avoid hits and maneuver in an attempt to gain a tactical advantage.

The unique game mechanics lie in the interaction of the move cards and 40 multicolored dice. However, to win, you will need not only luck, but also the ability to plan your actions and turn the game situation in your favor.

108010.name: Steel Thunder
108010.description:
Back of Box

America's four best battle tanks vs. Russia's top combat armor. Command a crack tank crew in any of the four frontline U.S. tanks, including the M1A1 Abrams--the most devastating military vehicle in history. Faster, more powerful than anything the other side has ever dreamed of. An indomitable war machine that rolls out of the west like steel thunder.


Command an exact replica of the M1A1 Abrams Main Battle Tank



Command an authentic M60A3, M48A5 Patton, and M3 Bradley Cavalry Fighting Vehicle



Fight countless battles on 24 missions in 3 major theaters of operation: Cuba, Syria and West Germany



Assume the roles of Commander, Driver and Gunner



Master authentic firing sequences and military land strategy



View battlefields from authentic in-tank perspectives



Includes a keyboard overlay and comprehensive operations manual


Steel Thunder. Nothing's conventional about warfare with 60 tons of lethal firepower at your command.

"Steel Thunder breaks new ground in the realm of graphic combat simulators" --Columbia Daily Tribune

[Photo captions:]

More Battles. 24 day and night missions in variable terrain: Cuba, Syria, West Germany.

More Tanks. All 4 front-line U.S. war machines including the near-invincible M1A1 Abrams.

More Realism. Actual tank stations and controls. 6 authentic weapons systems. Real thermal gunsights.

More Action. Fast-moving, high-res graphics. Detailed landscapes, targets, and explosions.

More Depth. True seat-of-the-pants tank combat. Real shooting sequences. Genuine armored strategy.

108011.name: Carrier Aces
108011.description: Carrier Aces is a flight simulation game taking place during World War II. Players control an aircraft pilot of either the United States or the Japanese air forces. Based aboard an aircraft carrier, players can do numerous missions in an effort to help the war effort. Campaign modes allow for all aircraft to have their own statistics and allow players to carry certain types of aircraft into the combat zone. All aircraft come equipped with a throttle, a speedometer, an altimeter, a compass, and a fuel tank.

108012.description:
April 14, 1912, 11:40 p.m.: In the dark, cold waters of the Atlantic ocean, the transatlantic RSM Titanic, during its first journey, sinks after a crash against an iceberg. The block of ice opens a hole in the right side of the hull and after two hours and forty minutes the Titanic is doomed.

One hundred years after those happenings, Sir Chester Cobblepot offers a refined board game that celebrates the unforgettable heroism and determination of the passengers on that English transatlantic. More specifically, our main characters are the survivors of the last lifeboat lowered into the water, the collapsible D.

The idea for Collapsible D: The Final Minutes of the Titanic comes from the mind of the Italian author Gianluca Santopietro. In this game the players are on board the Titanic during the night of April 14, 1912, starting at 11:40 p.m. when the ship collides with an iceberg; each turn represents ten minutes in real time. Each player controls a passenger of each Class and a member of the Crew. Each character has a different starting point, an attempt to recreate the exact location where they were on the ship, thanks to historical research led by the author in cooperation with history experts on the Titanic, such as Claudio Bossi. Thanks to an intuitive movement system, players will move their passengers through the ship, trying to reach the lifeboats on the dock.

Meanwhile, the water floods in quickly and the risk of drowning is very high. Each saved passenger grants victory points, and the player with the highest score wins.
108012.name: Collapsible D: The Final Minutes of the Titanic
videogamebg: Collapsible D: the Final Minutes of the Titanic

108013.name: Diversion
108013.description:
"Greetings! I am Garbot1, your HoverWorld host and guide. Nothing can prepare you more for the amazing adventures that await you in HoverWorld than ‘Diversion’ a fun filled hovering obstacle course of hazards and excitement. Don’t worry, I’ll guide you, OK, let’s GO!!"

- One touch controls
- 100 Levels
- 3 Unique 3D Worlds
- 150+ fully-animated playable characters to unlock and collect
- Lush 3D environments
- Physics powered by PhysX
- 3rd person camera: see all the action
- Different every time you play!
- Retina display graphics

Be amazed at what you can do with just one touch: run, jump, climb, hang, swim, zip, slide, and even fly! As you progress through levels you’ll unlock more challenging gameplay and hazards, including: spikes, chasms, zip-lines, slides, ledges, holes, buttons, spiderbots, bouncer bombs, water, laser walls, meteors, security drones, aliens, mutant sharks, chompers, stompers, lava, steam vents, blast vents, reversers, stoppers, portals, spike rollers, and more! 100 challenging levels will require timing and puzzle solving skills to complete and unlock the 150+ playable characters including: Ninja, Alien, Rocket, Karate, Robo, 60s, Zombie, Burglar, Tiger, Egyptian and even the Freaky Chicken and Future Banana!

Will this be your next Diversion?

Source: The Developer Website.

108014.name: Book of Classes
108014.description:
From the Introduction:

It is a feature of old school RPGs to offer a range of new character classes to supplement the basic ones that appear in the core rulebook. I don’t see any reason not to go along with this tradition and I therefore present the following classes for you to consider for your own campaign: Dervish, Gallowglass, Goliard, Knave, Marksman, Lore Warden, Spellsword and Witch/Warlock.

If you'd like to add further classes, you can readily adapt the ones that appear in Medieval Mysteries. You can even take classes from other class-and-level based games and tweak them to suit.

108015.name: John Tiller's Battleground Napoleonic Wars
108015.description:
John Tiller’s Battleground Napoleonic Wars puts the player in command of the mighty armies of the Napoleonic era, combining the time-tested interface and turn-based game mechanics that made John Tiller’s original game designs famous. With the choice of 2D or 3D battlefield view, dozens of scenarios and more historical information then can be found in most public libraries, John Tiller’s Battleground Napoleonic Wars brings gamers some of the most exciting battles and campaigns from Napoleons famous career.

Players can march across Eastern Europe against the Czar's armies with the original Napoleon in Russia, compete for position and advantage in Prelude to Waterloo, or fight the dramatic final battle of Napoleon in the original Waterloo or even take to the seas in Age of Sail, a bonus game included in this amazing package. Fans of John Tiller’s Napoleonics game mechanics will find this compilation to be a comprehensive and lasting addition to their strategy library. With a convenient difficulty slider and many optional rules, newcomers to the series can also enjoy John Tiller’s excellent game design. Furthermore, the terrain and order of battle for each scenario and campaign has been meticulously researched to create some of the most in-depth and immersive recreations of Napoleon’s major campaigns ever made!

Source: The Publisher Website.

108016.name: John Tiller's Battleground Civil War
108016.description:
Relive the brilliance and excitement of John Tiller’s classic Civil War games in this updated compilation, John Tiller’s Battleground Civil War. Included in the compilation are the original titles that gave the Battleground battle system the fame that has endured over years and years of play. Gamers can refight famous battles like Shiloh, Antietam, Bull Run, and Gettysburg with the fantastic realism and intuitive interface many fans of John Tiller’s gaming systems have come to expect and love

John Tiller’s Battleground Civil War includes multiple views of the battlefield to assure commanders can make informed decision in the heat of battle. To compliment the multiple vantage points is an option to view both 3D and 2D models to suit any gamer’s preference. Newcomers to this venerable strategy series will still enjoy their tactical splendor as much as the John Tiller's Battleground veteran. A simple advantage slider and a host of optional rules allows for custom tuning the AI’s difficulty and play experience to suit everyone’s needs. Finally, John Tiller’s Battleground Civil War includes stunningly accurate reconstructions of each battlefield, described as works of art by many, in addition to meticulously executed historical research, giving even the most learned Civil War buff the accuracy and realism they crave!

There’s no time to delay, soldier! Fall in and prepare to charge across the Battlegrounds of the Civil War!

Source: The Publisher Website.

Battles in this collection include 1st Bull Run, Wilson's Creek, Shiloh, 2nd Bull Run, South Mountain, Antietam, Prairie Grove, Stones River, Gettysburg, and Chickamauga.

108017.name: 'Jimmy'
108017.description:
Another failed attempt by Waddingtons, to get into the electronic board game market.

The pitch has several holes in it at strategic points. If the ball rolls into one of your holes, you press a button behind the goal and the ball is 'pinged' out of the hole and into another hole. You hope to keep possession and eventually shoot into the opponent's goal.

It had sound effects and an electronic score board but, as a game, it is almost entirely devoid of skill. You just press buttons.

108018.description:
Japanese Mahjong, especially called Riichi Mahjong (リーチ・マージャン）, is a very specific remake from Japan of the traditional Chinese Mahjong. It is as close and yet far from Chinese Mahjong as Shôgi (Japanese Chess) can be the same and yet different from original Chess. Mahjong was brought to Japan in 1904, but the Riichi form that is used in modern times probably originated from the 1920s. Today, the worldwide famous Mahjong Association officially recognized the complete rules of Riichi Mahjong for Tournaments.

The main differences are :
1) The 1-Yaku minimum: In order to win a hand, it can only be validated when your hand has at least one of the Yaku (specific hand combinations) in it.
2) Dora: A specific bonus tiles are indicated by the flipped tile from the dead wall and providing other possible Han bonus.
3) Riichi: When a player is Tenpai (one tile away from having a Mahjong hand, valid or not), he can bet a 1000 points chip to add one Yaku to his hand (thus validating a possible invalid hand). Winning with a Riichi hand allows access to the hidden ura-dora, which is an added dora indicator located underneath the revealed dora tile.
4) Abortive draws: Specific conditions, which ends a hand without winning prior to the drawing of all tiles, aside from the dead wall.
5) Scoring system: Much more complex than in Chinese Mahjong, it is based on hand combinations (Yaku) providing multipliers (Han) that combine with some other circumstantial points like the type of tiles in the hand (Fu) for any 4 han or less. The combination of Han and Fu correspond to a chart (and even an equation) to finally produce the hand's scoring points (Ten).

Some other minor elements in the Riichi Mahjong differ from the original Mahjong but are not important enough to be fully mentioned, like the Red 5 tiles (a non-official variant sometimes used which gives bonus like the Dora) or the validation of some Yaku (when the hand must be kept hidden or not, depending on the Japanese region where the game is played).
108018.name: Riichi Mahjong

108019.name: Rosette Riding School
108019.description:
Juvenile horse-riding themed dice-rolling game in two phases.

In part one, "Schooling Track", players throw a d6 to move around and collect (or lose) horseshoes.

In part two, "Cross Country Track", players use a die numbered 1,2,3 to move and attempt jumps. Horseshoe cards can be used to improve a die roll.

108020.name: Le mystère des pyramides
108020.description:
It is one of the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" games that resembles an audio cassette until you "flip" the game open.

The archaeologist takes the green marker and begins at the entrance to the pyramid.
The other player, the mummy, begins at the bottom of the pyramid.
A ruby is set in another room at the bottom of the pyramid.

The archaeologist will get the ruby and back out of the pyramid.
The mummy has to kill the archaeologist.

108021.name: Mod'Collection
108021.description:
Mod'Collection is one of the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" games that resembles an audio cassette until you "flip" the game open.

Each player will get a full set of clothes (shoes, skirt, top and jacket) to buy in shops. After that, they need to reach the final case.

108022.name: Safari photos
108022.description:
Each player take pictures of wild animals.

Each player moves around on a course of 6 animals and have the ability to take pictures.

The winner is the player who made the best photos (15 points photos).

108023.name: La cité terrifiante
108023.description:
A player takes the trafficker who should retrieve four items before fleeing by helicopter.
The other will pursue the trafficker in the city.

The two players move in the city with the dials. For the prosecuter, it must stop exactly on the case of the trafficker. The trafficker will go to the boxes objects in a specific order before running to the heliport.

108024.name: El Dilema / The Dilemma
108024.description:
It is a strategic game in which opponents should make them conducive chance.
You can play two, three, four and two teams of two players.

Each player receives 15 coins to start the game.
The first action of the game is to fill the board with so many games.
After each set the players traded currencies as the play tells them. And redo the box
score play.
The game ends when one player gets all the coins.
Each player is identified with one of the letters: A, B, C or D, and with a color: Blue,
Red, Green and Yellow.


Es un juego estratégico, en el que los adversarios deben hacer que el azar les sea
propicio.
Pueden jugar dos, tres, cuatro y dos equipos de dos jugadores.

Cada jugador recibe 15 monedas al iniciar la partida.
La primera acción del juego es llenar el tablero con los tantos de juego.
Después en cada lance los jugadores intercambian las monedas que la jugada les indica.
Y rehacen la puntuación de la casilla jugada.
El juego finaliza cuando un jugador se queda con todas las monedas.
Cada jugador se identifica con una de las letras: A, B, C o D; y con un color: Azul,
Rojo, Verde y Amarillo.

108025.name: Chill: Into the Unknown Quick Start
108025.description:
From Introduction:

The world of Chill is a world of horror. However, it is also a world where mankind fights to take back the night in the face of that horror.

In Chill, you play an envoy, an agent of the secretive organization SAVE, a group dedicated to the observation, study, and eventual destruction of "the Unknown." What exactly is the Unknown? Well, SAVE isn’t exactly sure. They have a working theory, but almost nothing can be said for certain of what SAVE's founder called "the Enemy" save one thing: it is a source of unspeakable evil.

Your envoy was once a normal person, but exposure to the Unknown has awakened something heroic in him (or her). SAVE, in its fight against the Unknown, watches for people who have survived such encounters, and brings them into the organization to help with the fight. Now, your envoy and others, travel the world in search of elusive clues and weapons to battle the Horrors and defend against the magic and machinations of the Unknown.

In the world of Chill, the Unknown spawns Horrors both familiar and alien. Vampires, werewolves, zombies and their like come from the Unknown, but there are other horrors that defy description. One thing is certain. When the Unknown is present, nothing is safe or normal. If a vampire moves into town, the crime rate increases, domestic violence increases, the weather changes, children suffer nightmares and wake in cold sweats. When the Unknown enters our world from its shadowy plane of terror, it brings with it corruption that gets right into the marrow of our reality and starts sucking.

108027.name: Secret Service: Security Breach
108027.description:
User Summary

Secret Service: Security Breach puts you in charge of protecting the leader of the free world. Use your skills and instincts to defend the President from terrorism! Become a new Secret Service recruit, seeking to perfect his skills and become a ranking agent in the Service Prepare to deal with a number of life-threatening situations, fighting against threats to national security Rely on your instincts and training to detect threats and stop terrorists before they attack Stop terrorists actions before they can become a reality.

108028.name: Supercow
108028.description:
Professor Duriarti, an infamous criminal, recently escaped from prison and seized the farm in Sunny Valley. Life in Sunny Valley went to hell. Professor Duriarti captured all of the animals and cloned them! The cloned animals are helping the evil professor carry out his diabolical plan of completely destroying the Earth. Supercow learned about the situation through her network of informants and dashed off to save the animals. Because after all, who knows how to save the farm better than Supercow?

Source: The Developer Website.

108029.name: Bite Mark (Vol. 1, Issue 1 - May 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Rules from the Cutting Room Floor - Character Backgrounds
108029.description:
Contents:

1, Editor’s Note
Jadeclaw Background Information
1, Zhongguo Calendar -Yin-yang li by Chuan Lin
Variant Rules
5, Variant Races by Jason Holmgren
Rules from the Cutting Room Floor
7, Character Background by Chuan Lin
18, Submission Guideline
Jadeclaw Adventure:
19, Gift of the Ancestors by Chuan Lin

108030.name: Secret Service (2008)
108030.description:
User Summary

It's Inauguration Day and an extremist assault has been launched on Washington D.C. and the nation's top leaders. Security has been fully compromised from the Capitol steps to the White House with indications of inside infiltration. You're thrust out of the shadows and into the line of fire to save the country's leadership. Key Features Story-based run and gun FPS with plot twists! Authentic Secret Service weapons and gear! Sniper rifles, Uzis, grenades, assault rifles, and more Encrypted communication modules, top secret bunkers, etc Intense engagements across the nation's landmarks! Lincoln Memorial, Capitol Mall & steps, the White House No place is safe and there is no escape! Enemy assaults aboard Marine One and Air Force One!

108031.name: Dance Mania
108031.description:
It's time to break out and hit the dance floor! You can boogie to one of the three beats on the electronic dance unit or play your own slammin' tunes to groove to. The more you play, the better you'll get...that's when you start improvising! The dancer that scores the most points, by collecting cards while dancing, become the Bratz Disco Queen.

Contents:

electronic dance unit- pink & white speaker,
gameboard,
pack of 36 double- sided dance cards,
instructions

108032.description:
Canada Quiz is a trivia that integrates tactical elements.

The goal of the game is to be the first player (or team) to get the Canada flag by answering properly the questions.

The board has four playing track (one per player or team), leading to the flag in the centre of the board. Each player (or team) has four markers. The dice is rolled to bring a marker in play and or to move it along the track; however, a marker can be moved only if the question asked is properly answered. When a player answers without a "hint" (without asking which are the multiple choices listed on the card), that player can have an other question, so an other opportunity to move forward. Under some conditions, the questions may also be used to perform a "power-play", which could force an other player to move backward. The first player to reach the flag and to answer properly the question wins the game.

Canada Quiz has 250 question cards, with four questions (with multiple answers) on each, for a total of 1000 questions. The trivia game is based on early the history of Canada, mainly covering the historical period from the very beginnings up to the Confederation. Canada Quiz has been published in English and in French.
108032.name: Canada Quiz

108033.name: T-72: Balkans on Fire
108033.description:
T-72: Balkans on Fire! is a groundbreaking new tank simulation by Russian game developers IDDK/Crazy House and published by Battlefront.com. The focus of the game is the control of the your own tank, but the ability to command a number of attached units (armor, vehicles and infantry up to platoon strength) is given through the use of a command and navigation map. Artificial Intelligence (AI) controlled tank crewmen can man any station and be ordered by the player via hotkey's, or you can take the seat as tank commander, gunner, or driver yourself at any time. Internal and external free motion camera views provide an exciting and dynamic overview of the battlefield.The simulation’s main focus is on tank combat tactics on the modern battlefield. The inside of the playable tanks is simplified in an easy to use game user interface (GUI) for playability reasons, but it has no impact on realism - all aspects of the tasks of a tank crew are simulated in extreme detail from hand cranking a broken turret to manually shifting gears and applying the parking brakes.

Source: The Publisher Website.

108034.name: Gatling Gears
108034.description:
Gatling Gears is a twin-stick top-down shooter for Xbox LIVE Arcade, PlayStation Network, and PC. When the Empire begins its reign of destruction in a thirst for natural resources, it’s up to Max Brawley, a retired Gatling Gear pilot, to stop them. Together with his niece and his trusty Gatling Gear unit he must fight his way to the heart of the Empire and eliminate the destruction at its source.

Source: The Developer Website.

108035.name: Fishdom
108035.description:
Build up and develop your Fishdom! Progress through challenging boards and solve immersive puzzles to earn cash. Use the money to buy eye-candy fish and attractive ornaments for your dream aquarium. Get accessories and supplies to create the perfect conditions for your finny pals and ensure their comfort. Win awards and upgrade your virtual tank as you perfect your aquarium design skills and have fun with the lovely fishy sims. Being a unique fusion of classic gameplay with brilliant new ideas, this game by Playrix with unlimited replayability will bring you lots of joyful moments!

Source: The Developer Website.

108036.name: Eric Young's Squad Assault: West Front
108036.description:
Box top description

Command troops in both the Allied and German Armies of the West Front of World War II in an immersive, fully 3D continuous time environment. Detailed models for all the major armies that fought in France in 1944 are available, including American, German, British, Canadian, and Free French.

108037.name: Fishdom H2O: Hidden Odyssey
108037.description:
Help Jennifer, a young marine biologist, win the Best Aquarium Award. Dive to the bottom of the sea and find various hidden items in numerous eye-teasing locations. Get cash for them to buy cute sea creatures and beautiful ornaments to create three unique aquariums. Choose from tons of accessories and supplies to make the life of your exotic swimming pets fun and comfortable. Become a genuine aquarist, polish your design skills and win trophies in this dazzling hidden object spin-off of the original Fishdom - a game by Playrix where dream aquariums come true!

Source: The Developer Website.

108038.name: G.I. Combat: Episode 1 – Battle of Normandy
108038.description:
Box top description

It's June of 1944 -- you're on the beach at Normandy where you'll strive for victory against the Nazi menace. Join up with your troops and enter a full 3D environment with unsurpassed detail. Over 60 different squad types and dynamic events make sure it's never the same campaign. Hold back enemy offensives, lead an assault to capture key objectives, and charge into combat with determined grunts who'll lay down their lives for you. Can you succeed where others failed and alter the outcome of World War II's most important battles?

108039.name: Chop Chop Slicer
108039.description:
Play as Alexis Rocket and defend yourself against hordes of enemies using your Slicer weapon!

Transform your finger into a razor-sharp weapon and fight Aliens with the precise Slice ‘n Dice technology:

Precise complex object slicing:

The player gets to decide at which precise position and angle the object will be cut. Chop Chop Slicer also features detailed concave targets, unlike most slicing games which use pre-determined cutting angles on simple convex objects.

Real-time mesh slicing technology with physics dynamics:

The fragmentation caused by the slicing action creates realistic fall patterns based on the laws of physics. An object can be cut multiple times, thus creating accurate and visually stunning graphic effects.

Dynamic squad-based tactics for AI movement patterns:

Chop Chop Slicer uses a variety of dynamic movement patterns, inspired by military tactics. The enemy flies in organized groups to attack in order to enhance the player’s experience. This feature adds tremendous challenge to the gameplay, especially in arcade mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

108040.name: Recon by Fire: Issue 2
108040.description:
44 pages. Includes 10 scenarios, an APC player aid chart and a large (DASL) map, BF2.

8 of the scenarios are East front, with one west front scenario, and one end war Russian v. Japanese scenario.

The scenarios are:

RBF-9: Rolling Stones

RBF-10: Tip Off at Tauroggen

RBF-11: Gut Check

RBF-12: Sverdlikova Melee

RBF-13: Neubauer Battalion

RBF-14: Kampfgruppe Lang

RBF-15: Shumilinmo

RBF-16: The Bitter End

RBF-17: Third Hotspot

RBF-18: First Day at Fuchin

108041.name: Bite Mark (Vol. 1, Issue 2 - Aug 2002)
rpgissuearticle: An Introduction to Wuxia and Jadeclaw
A Night in House of Sun Inn
108041.description:

1, Wolf at the Tiger’s Tail by Ludi Price & Chuan Lin
7, An Introduction to Wuxia and Jadeclaw by Chuan Lin
13, A Night in House of Sun Inn by Chuan Lin

108042.description:

11, An Adventure to Campaign by Michael J. Simmons
16, The Giant Rat of Sumatra by Marvin E. Fuller

108043.name: Bite Mark (Vol. 1, Issue 4 - Feb 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Carta da gioco in Calabria, Part I
Tales of the Travelling Gazelle - Triskellian
108043.description:
Contents:

3, The Sleeping Lady, Part II by Matt Trepal
14, The Black Dog by Marvin E. Fuller
22, Skyal by Michael J. Simmons
27, Tales of the Travelling Gazelle—Triskellian by Michael J. Simmons
34, Asclepious Rising by Michael J. Simmons
39, Carta da gioco in Calabria, Part I by Chuan Lin
45, Sanguine & Conventions

108044.description:
Your genius could have been such a boon to humanity. Your death ray had wonderful pest control applications, and your volcano activator was perfect for fighting global warming. But the fools at the institute, they wouldn't listen. They called you mad! You built a monster to rend them limb from limb, which your minions assured you was the very worst way to be rended. When it became clear that the only hope for the world was your own benign leadership, you took control of TV to announce this fact. But your broadcast was interrupted by someone else taking control of TV and announcing his own plan for world domination – and then that broadcast was interrupted by yet another interloper. So. Competition. Well, the world will never be as scared of these upstarts as it will be of you. Archimedes once said, "Give me a long enough lever and a place to stand, and I will move the world." You will be the most terrifying lever the world has ever seen.

Nefarious is a quick-playing game in which the players race to build inventions like a freeze ray, cloaking device, or robotic pet before their opponents can do the same. (Interesting side note: Eighteen different artists contributed to the artwork on the different inventions in the game.)

Nefarious is played over several rounds. In each round the players simultaneously choose and reveal one of their actions that will allow them to allocate one of their Minions to an area on their Lair, obtain money, obtain a blueprint for an invention, or build one of their inventions if they have enough money to do so. The minions that you allocate to your Lair can earn you additional income depending on the actions that your neighbors choose. The first player to build 20 or more points worth of Inventions AND have more points than any other player wins.

There is a twist to the game, though – actually, two twists! At the beginning of the game, you randomly draw two Twist cards, which change the environment so that the game plays differently each time. This means that in order to win, the players will have to revise their strategies each time they play Nefarious.
108044.name: Nefarious
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ben Goes To Gen-Con And Our Review of Nefarious!
Carnagecast Extrasode 5: A Dark and Stormy Night
Episode 107-- Gen Con 2015 Wrap up and La Granja Review

What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 59!!! A Contest Inside!

11, Sanguine & Convention

19, Ironclaw Adventure—Blessed Bones by Gareth Larter

108049.name: Pants! Card Game
108049.description:
Pants! is a super silly family card game of trouser-collecting and wardrobe-stealing. Build your wardrobe of classy pants, sporty pants, adventure pants, or casual pants before your opponents do.

But hold tight to your trousers because they can get stolen right from under your nose!

Each card is artfully designed with a retro-funky pants illustration. Let’s play!

The cards consist of different wardrobe categories: Classy, Sporty, Casual, Adventure. There are four unique types of pants in each wardrobe category. For example, Classy Pants consists of stripey dress pants, tuxedo pants, a gown, and a kilt.

The object is to collect two full sets of pants from two different categories. The first player to do that wins. There are wild cards you can play to thwart your opponents' pants collection: Suspenders and gift card. Just when you're ready to lay down your winning set of pants, another player can steal your set or make you put it back. Ouch.
There's also an underwear wild card you can use with three pairs of pants in a category to make a complete set. Wee!

Game play goes like this: Each player is dealt five cards. In a turn of play, you can:
• Lay down a complete set of pants
• Discard pants cards you don't need
• Pick from the discard pile to get cards you need

Its Kickstarter campaign failed to reach its funding goal on October 7 2011.

108051.name: Personal Trainer: Math
108051.description:
From the back of the box

Personal Trainer: Math gives you a fun and rewarding way to improve your math abilities. Improve your skills with dozens of exercises, from simple addition and subtraction to multiplication tables and more, or compete with friends or classmates in a variety of multiplayer challenges.

108053.description:
Hansa: The Compass is a small expansion for Michael Schacht's board game Hansa that randomizes the direction of movement on the game board.

Before the game begins, one player spins the "compass" tile. Depending on which side is face-up, the merchant ship either moves with or against the arrows on the game board for the entirety of the game.
108053.name: Hansa: The Compass

108054.name: Mechanical Yacht Race
108054.description:
Early 20th century action game.

Your yacht is attached to a length of string in such a way that if the string is pulled, raised or shaken, the player can make the yacht 'sail' along the string to the finish line. The strings are attached to the table. The box illustrates rather well the set-up and the game-play.

Really cute cats are in the illustration on the box, watching mother and son playing the game.

108055.name: Freestyle Street Soccer
108055.description:
Freestyle Street Soccer is a sports video game released in 2004 by Silicon Dreams. It is also known as Urban Freestyle Soccer in Europe.

Source: Wikipedia, "Freestyle Street Soccer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108056.name: Tennis Game and Badminton
108056.description:
One of Waddingtons' Target Series games, aimed at the customer on a strict budget.

Each player has a plastic 'racket' that is rather like a see-saw. You put the 'ball' onto your racket, push the handle of the racket down and, hopefully, the ball would land within the confines of the board. If successful, your opponent now returns the ball in the same way.

Both tennis and badminton play in the same way and you score as in the real rules for either sport.

108057.name: The Game of Punch and Judy
108057.description:
Simple race game. The object is to reach the end of the track first so that you can see the Punch & Judy show.
The track has several negative squares, Lose 1 turn, lose 2 turns and Go Back to Start. There are no positive squares.
You need an exact throw to win.

108058.name: 7 gunfighters
108058.description:
User Summary

A first person shooter for the XBL Indie Marketplace. Choose a target, walk around a town shooting other gunfighters attempting to kill you until you reach your target. Enemies jump in and out of the buildings, shoot them before they shoot you or go back into cover.

108059.name: Avatar Paintball
108059.description:
User Summary

A third person shooter where you try to shoot other players Avatar with yours. Choose from four different paintball guns and find power ups on the map to make you stronger.

108060.name: Marksman: Long Range
108060.description:
User Summary

An Xbox Live Indie game that attempts to simulate long range rifle shooting. Set your scope, load your rifle, steady your breath, check wind conditions, and slowly pull the trigger to try to hit the high scoring area of the target. Choose from eight different rifles that all behave differently.

108061.name: Escape from the Underground Space
108061.description:
User Summary

A Japanese "room escape game". This is a point and click adventure game where very little information is given, with the goal of escaping the room the game takes place in.

108062.name: Escape from the Meeting Room
108062.description:
User Summary

A Japanese "room escape game". This is a point and click adventure game where very little information is given, with the goal of escaping the room the game takes place in.

As the title suggests, this one involves escaping from a meeting room.

108063.name: Escape from the Pumpkin Room
108063.description:
User Summary

A Japanese "room escape game". This is a point and click adventure game where very little information is given, with the goal of escaping the room the game takes place in.

108064.name: Numenko-in-a-bag
108064.description:
Numenko-in-a-bag features game play and components similar to the Numenko board game - but without a game board and with a few other changes.

The wooden tiles feature digits (0-9), a Multichoice symbol (that stands for the player's choice of addition, subtraction, multiplication, division or "is equal to"), and a Freechoice symbol (that can be a digit or Multichoice). Each player starts with 20 randomly drawn tiles (if playing with 2-4 players; 15 tiles otherwise) and one Freechoice tile. The remaining tiles are mixed face-down on the table.

Playing at the same time, players reveal their tiles and try to create valid equations crossword-style in their own playing area. A Multichoice or Freesymbol tile can be used as a different operator or number in intersecting equations. At any time, a player can return an unwanted tile to the stock in exchange for two newly drawn tiles. If a player uses all of his tiles in one or more equations, then he declares "Done" and draws four new tiles from the stock. Players can rearrange tiles any number of times to incorporate new tiles.

The game ends if a player wants to swap when fewer than two tiles remain in reserve or declares "Done" with fewer than four tiles in reserve. The player who has used all tiles in equations when the game ends wins. If no player fits this description, then players sum their tiles in hand (with a Freechoice tile worth ten points), and the player with the lowest sum wins.

108066.name: Austerlitz
108066.description:
User Summary

Austerlitz is a tactical wargame and represents an accurate simulation of Napoleon's greatest victory against the Third Coalition on December 2, 1805. You, as the commander of the French army, pit yourself once again against the joint Russian and Austrian forces, trying to repeat this formidable French victory.

108067.name: Doctor Azoth
108067.description:
From the publisher:

Doctor Azoth is a legend, a mythical figure who exists only in stories, or at least that's what everyone thought before he and his Homonculi showed up in Emerald City. Now the master alchemist sends his servants out to do his bidding; Man-Drake, the poison-breathing dragon-man, Petra, the stone-like alchemical warrior woman, and Takwin, the shapeshifting swordsman. How will your heroes handle an entire team of alchemical adversaries? This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

108068.name: Mastermind
108068.description:
From the publisher:

Taken, tortured, and torn apart by ancient aliens thousands of years ago, a primitive hunter arose from death to become the immortal avatar of human potential known as Mastermind. His schemes hidden throughout history, his time has come to take his rightful place as the leader of a new civilization. Humanity will realize its potential under his guidance, or face the wrath of his tremendous mental powers! This product is an update of a classic Mutants & Masterminds villain for the game's Third Edition.

108069.name: Sutmark
108069.description:
From the publisher:

Once a prosperous realm, Sutmark has seen a rapid decline in fortunes. Political machinations in Ostmark strip it of its trade routes, while the massive lizardman army batters at the walls of Ostvik. If either trade or army fails, Sutmark will swiftly fall, overrun by hordes of scaly invaders and their thunderlizards. The fate of the nation hangs in the balance.

108070.name: Angarion
108070.description:
From the publisher:

Angarion, the last remnants of an ancient forest, is home to the largest population of hearth elves in Rassilon. Here they dwell in harmony with the world, shunning contact with other races and defending their homes with lethal efficiency as they have done for time immemorial. Their numbers are dwindling, but they remain resolute in holding to the old ways of their ancestors. Much of the material in this work applies to all hearth elf domains.

108071.name: The Borderlands
108071.description:
From the publisher:

The loose confederation of villages and towns that make up this frontier land have weathered the terrors of the Liche-Priest and the ravages of the Blizzard War. Orcs, giants, and beastmen are constant threats, yet the Borderlands remains a bustling center of trade. Here there are plentiful opportunities to earn money and glory. There is also much danger.

108072.name: The Abyss
108072.description:
From the publisher:

The Abyss is the realm of the damned, where those who commit terrible sins in life or die without a patron deity are sent to suffer for eternity. This supplement takes a look at the denizens of the Abyss and the depraved, black-hearted mortals who traffic with them. It is not an adventurers guide to exploring the hellish realm or laying waste to its near godlike rulers. Nor is it a supplement of hard facts and absolutes. Instead, it presents a variety of commonly held opinions, any of which might be true.

108073.name: Godsheim
108073.description:
From the publisher:

The nature of the Afterlife and the homes of the gods have kept imaginations fired and fueled debate for millennia. Every race, culture, and nation has its own opinions. Yet even these are not set in stone, for different generations apply their own interpretations to holy texts and the myths of old, shaping them to fit current events and mores so they remain pertinent to worshippers. This supplement provides an overview of Godsheim, a realm shaped by the beliefs of mortals. This Region Guide explores the gods' halls and the major geographic features of their celestial realm, the nature of celestial events, and the major constellations. A star chart of the night sky completes the supplement.

108074.name: Hellfrost: Heroes & Villians
108074.description:
From the publisher:

The population of the winter-wracked northern lands is not particularly high, but it is varied. Commoners and nobles, mages and clerics, healers and warriors, merchants and thieves, wise men and fools, heroes and cowards, all walk the frozen realm.

Most have mundane dreams. They want to feed their families, earn enough money to pay their taxes, avoid being killed by some horrible beast, serve their lord loyally, survive another winter, and, when their time comes, die a peaceful and painless death.

But those the Norns have touched have greater goals, often affecting many lives. Some crave base things such as wealth and power, others desire revenge for actual or perceived wrongs, seek to unlock the mysteries of the world, complete a grand quest, slay monstrous beasts, defeat fell cults, be praised and renowned for their glorious actions, or simply make the world a better place. These are the men and women who, while they may not be the subject of skalds’ tales, will feature in them, for their destinies are intertwined with those the Norns have fated to be true heroes.

This supplement contains 31 fully detailed NPCs, both villainous and benevolent, ready to be dropped into any Hellfrost campaign or used as player characters.

108075.name: Wonderland No More: Adventure Deck
108075.description:
From the publisher:

Just in case your Wonderland No More games need a little more wonder we present the Wonderland No More Adventure Cards. A set of 56 cards specific to Wonderland (though you could use them in any Savage Worlds game if you want to!)

108076.name: Legendary Battles
108076.description:
This game is a chess variant, -according to wikipedia definitions and chessvariants.org- with fantastic theme. Each player controls an army. There are four different armies to choose and each one has their own particular attributes. In every army there are 4 soldiers, 2 sergeants, 2 lieutenants, 2 generals, one special unit and a King.
Is played on an hex board.
Each piece has some symbols that indicate their moving and capturing capacities and, sometimes, a special ability.

108077.description:
In 19th Century Britain, sports were invented and developed to provide the idle rich with a means of betting large sums of money against each other. In The Victorian Gamer you are one of the idle rich.
No aristocrat worthy of his name would have been without a fast running footman or a stable boy who was a particularly able jockey. He would put up his ‘man’ against another noble’s ‘man’ for an agreed sum. The sport was incidental; it was the outcome that counted, with the winner taking all. And of course, a whole new industry of side betting with bookies quickly emerged.
The Victorian Gamer mirrors this era. There are three different events – running, rowing and horseracing - each one having its own unique gameplay. In addition, players can make bets against each other and/or with the bookie. And furthermore, to add a bit of extra spice there are three differently numbered dice to form the odds and affect the outcomes.
In short, there are three different races, two ways of betting, but only one winner. For friends and family with even the tiniest element of a competitive streak, The Victorian Gamer will provide hours of fun, not to mention a few squabbles, huffs and sulks. Warning – NOT A GAME FOR BAD LOSERS.
108077.name: The Victorian Gamer

boardgamehonor: 2011 UK Games Expo Best Party Game Winner
108078.name: The Know It Game
108078.description:
The Know It Game is the trivia game where simply answering correctly isn’t enough. To win you have to successfully bluff your opponents into believing you know the answer.
The questions are original, amusing and informative and the games can be traded, swapped or collected.
Each box consists of two broad themes and there are over 200 questions per theme split into five games.
Answer correctly, you win the card. Claim to ‘Know It’, you could win two.

108079.description:
Bibliogamo is a solitaire game of book production and libraries. In this game you will play the role of a publisher in the city of Bibliogamo. Using cards to hire artisans, you will put them to work in six city tower workshops, each devoted to a different kind of book. The Chief Librarian of the City will, in turn, tour the city buying books at what he considers their proper value. Prestige Collection cards generate victory points depending on how well you can fulfill the requirements of the Chief Librarian’s collection.

Needed to play: the game board showing the city of Bibliogamo, the 47 Artisan cards, the 7 Prestige Collection cards, 26 black eurocubes representing your Artisans, and 16 red eurocubes to act as track markers in the game. Additionally you’ll need one pawn to represent the Librarian.

Win: The game is over when the Time Track eurocube reaches [40] and you complete your turn. For each book you produce, you gain 1VP. For each 5 Florins you have, you gain 1 VP. Prestige VP is awarded as indicated on the Prestige Collection card chosen at the start of the game. Your total VP is your score for the game.

The Five Turn Phases:
1. Move the time track eurocube forward one day closer to [40].

2. Move the Librarian Pawn clockwise 3 spaces, then turn over the top Artisan card from the draw pile on to the discard pile and move the Librarian accordingly as indicated by the Librarian icon on the left-hand side of the card.

3. Look at the small Artisan icon below the Librarian icon on this same card. You may not play any card with that Artisan symbol on it this turn unless you discard a card from your hand with a matching small Artisan icon.

4. You may now do any of the following, but in order:
a. Pay 1 Florin to move the Librarian forward or backward one space. You may pay 1 Florin for each space you wish to move the Librarian.
b. Sell a book, if completed, in the Tower the Librarian is currently standing on. Turn over the next 2 Artisan cards from the draw deck. Place the second card to the right of the first and look at the florin value on the second card as indicated by the Florin icon at on the first card. This is the amount the Librarian is willing to pay for this book. You may pay extra 1 day of time to turn over another card replacing the current Florin amount. You may continue to do this, paying 1 day of time per card turned over, until you are satisfied with the price.
Mark this amount on your Florin Track and return all Artisan eurocubes from the completed book to your pool. Then mark the production of a book on your Book track, moving the red eurocube forward one space, and if the book is one of those needed for a Prestige Collection, mark that book on the Prestige Collection card as well with a red eurocube. Note: you may pay extra days of time only if they remain on the Time Track. Lastly, place all drawn cards used to calculate the Florin value on the discard pile.
c. Discard one Artisan card from your hand to the discard pile and place that number of black eurocubes on the Artisans indicated by the card, on any one Tower. Then discard one more card from your hand to pay for those Artisans. You may do this action twice if you wish. You do not receive any surplus Artisans from the discarded card. Nor do you receive any surplus Artisans if your tower already has the number required for that Artisan type. The second time you do this action you may add Artisans to the same tower or a different one.

5. Draw back to a hand of 5 cards. If the draw deck is exhausted, shuffle the discard cards for a new draw deck.
108079.name: Bibliogamo

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
108080.description:
The land is corrupted. The silent Grayking, brooding upon his throne in the Tower of Ash, is a far-reaching shadow upon Lassadar. We feel his presence in each of our days. His servants grow bold, stealing into our cities, inhabiting the alleys and dark places of our streets. They jeer at us from our mirrors, shaming our reflections.

The books of the Council of Wardens, handed down to us across the years, say that the era of broken barriers is upon us. Omens tell us, by winter, the Grayking will break through the few defenses we have remaining, cross to Lassadar, and our lands will fall to despair.

We few who are left, who remember the Grayking’s original imprisonment across the Barrier Planes, struggle to keep his power from growing further, but we have little time and far too few disciples. You are young but have proven to hold the strength of our teaching inside you. We have trained you in the arcane arts of ice, oak and flint magic and have taught you those powers are capricious and can damage your spirit if relied upon too much. We wish we had more time to train you further. We do not.

Go now into the wider world, with our blessings, and seek a means to defeat the Grayking. Find the three Warding Keys stolen by his servants and re-lock the gates to force him back behind the Barrier Planes forever. Our agents, spread thinly across places still untouched in Lassadar, will aid you in your quest as best they can.

Go now, and save us all……

Shadows Upon Lassadar is a solitaire fantasy quest game. You play a young magic adept who has been charged with finding three lost keys to lock the gates between the Barrier Plains and prevent the Grayking from reaching the world of Lassadar. You will journey to different cities using a deck of cards; other cards list spells you learn during the game. Magic in Lassadar is, however, a two edged sword and if you use powerful spells you may end up corrupting your own spirit in the process and lose the game. Three specific cards lead to expanded battle maps where you fight the Grayking’s servants for possession of the keys. The game uses a variety of AI mechanics to simulate an enemy that learns and adapts as the game progresses.

Needed to play:
the 48 game cards + the 4 last battle cards
9 six sided dice
25 black eurocubes
and 3 eurocubes: one each in red, blue and yellow.

This Print and Play game can be assembled as a deck of cards or as cards and a series of mini game boards.

There are several types of quests in the game that will need to be completed. These quests are encountered by turning over cards from the draw deck:

City Quest cards showing the name of the city you’ve journeyed to, win and loss table reference icons and event instructions for the battle in that city. As you win battles in these cities you will remove these cards from the game. If you lose a battle in this city you will place this card on the Quest discard pile to be shuffled back into the game. Dice are rolled to determine the outcome of these battles.

Council of Wardens Quest cards always have a white top. Their event instructions will help you gain spells and refresh your Mana and Spirit. These cards will always be placed on the Quest discard pile to be shuffled back into the game.

Three Warding City Quest cards, each with a colored band and a numbered Warding Key icon across the bottom will signal when you use the Expanded Battle Maps (wargame hexmap style). On the Expanded Battle Maps you will encounter AI driven servants of the Grayking. Dice are rolled to determine the outcome of these battles. As you win the battles in these cities, and gain the Warding Keys, you will remove these cards from the game. If you lose a battle in this city you will place this card on the Quest discard pile, to be shuffled back into the game.

Winning or losing the game:

Draw cards one by one working your way through the quest. If you gain each of the 3 Warding keys you may cast the Oaken Spell: Barrier Lock and lock the gates of the Barrier Plains. The Grayking is instantly drawn back to the Tower of Ash and you have saved Lassadar and won the game.

If at any time your Spirit falls below [1] on the Character Stats card, or if the Grayking reaches Lassadar on the Progress Track, you have lost the game.

2nd place in the August 2011 Solitaire Print and Play contest
and was also awarded Best Art, Best AI and Best Horror Game

Tied for 1st place in The 2011 Print 'n Play Awards for Best Solitaire Game

2012 Golden Geek Awards Nominee - http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/864240/2012-golden-geek-...
108080.name: Shadows Upon Lassadar
boardgamepodcastepisode: Printin’ and Playin’ Episode 20 – Shadows Upon Lassadar

108081.name: The Fugitives and the Flock
108081.description:
publisher blurb

In our second Infinite Power RPG Adventure, your heroes have been called upon by the Chief of Police to lend a hand in a super powered hostage situation. This turns into a difficult choice between helping some fugitives and facing down the Flock. Do the Heroes come to the aid of the fugitives, or do they dare incur the wrath of Thunderbird and his Flock? Can the Heroes cure the fugitives and restore their lives? Will the city survive the Heroes' interference? Only you and your Heroes can determine the answers.

108082.name: Requiem
108082.description:
REQUIEM:
Enter the nightmarish dream world as a giant creature out to destroy you, is chasing you. You don't know where you are, or why you are there, but things have an eerie familiarity. Jump, climb, or crawl, over obstacles to survive and find a way to escape before it's too late. The only thing that matters now is that you Run!!!

Universal App - Requiem can be played on iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPad, iPad 2, iPod Touch 3 (16 GB and Above), and iPod Touch 4 all for a single low price.

Optimization - Requiem is optimized for the iPhone 4 and iPad 2 - It includes high-end graphics that utilize the enhanced visual capabilities of the iPhone 4 and iPad 2.

GAMEPLAY:

An exciting 3D runner in which you are being chased by an impossibly large and evil creature that will require twitch thinking reaction to escape while overcoming insane obstacles.

GROUND BREAKING CONTROLS:

Sprint, Crouch, Jump, Control Pegasus with Next Gen Tilt Controls.

GAME CENTER:

Achievements and Leaderboard - Over 25 Achievements, Challenge your friends in the Game Center Leaderboard!

Source: The Game Website.

108083.name: Crimson: Steam Pirates
108083.description:
A new game developed by Harebrained Schemes and published by Bungie Aerospace, Crimson: Steam Pirates is a swashbuckling adventure that takes place on, above, and below the Caribbean Sea. Command pirate steamships, airships, and submarines with an elegant user interface in this turn-based strategy game with stunning graphics and animations!

Thomas Blood crossed the Atlantic in chains, an enemy of the English Crown condemned by Queen Victoria herself. But his destiny was as a free man, a captain of a steam-powered frigate, a hero sailing the crimson seas…and a pirate.

Source: The Developer Website.

Steam Pirate Action

Plumes of black smoke fill the blue Caribbean sky as Thomas Blood’s pirate fleet steams ahead—over, above, and below the waves. Available now, for free on iPad!

Command your fleet and your Steampunk crew using an elegant action interface. Crimson: Steam Pirates' turn-based gameplay provides an addicting mixture of strategy and action as you anticipate your enemies' moves and counter them, luring them into a deadly hail of weapons fire while uncovering the mystery brewing in the Caribbean.

Features


8 voyages that begin the tale of Thomas Blood's adventures in the Caribbean
2 "Pass-and-Play" multiplayer scenarios
Over a dozen types of ships, subs, and airships
Over 20 unique crew members whose special abilities enhance gameplay
Bungie.net Stats, Leaderboards, and Facebook integration.


Source: The Publisher Website.

108084.description:
Delicious cakes are lined up for you! Just eat as many as you can and as fast as you can!

In this game, there are four types of cakes, and they may fit into the four empty slots one has in front of oneself. Each player has a deck of cards and starts drawing cards and placing them out on the slots, simultanously. The new cards on hand are placed on top of the corresponding piles. In addition to different cake types, the cards also display between 1-3 cakes/card. It is therefore better to place 1-cake cards on other players' piles/slots and the 3-cake cards on your own piles.

The game ends when the first player to finish his/her deck shouts "I'm full!". That player gets an additional 3 bonus VPs. Each player then counts the number of cakes, getting 1VP/cake and adding them with any bonus VPs. The winner is the one who gains the most VPs (i.e. the one who has eaten the most cakes in the shortest time).


The new version of My Cake! has been released in September 2011. In this second version there are 108 cards and the brand new artwork makes these cakes even more delicious! The addition of two new rules of play offers more variety in your gaming experience.
108084.name: My Cake!

108087.name: Confrontation (1983)
108087.description:
User Summary

Confrontation is a tactical wargame for one or two players. It includes seven ready-made scenarios of battles throughout the 20th century. These are: Poland, Crete, Desert War, Greece, Angola, Afghanistan and Sinai. Additionally, you can create and play your own mini scenarios using whatever terrain type and weaponry you wish to include.

108088.description: In Penguin Panic: The Great Icescape, the players control penguin placement in a prison yard. Using a Venn diagram the players place penguins into various places that will benefit themselves, filling up the area they have control of. Each player needs to help penguins escape from the prison. Careful placement allows the penguins to escape the region they have filled up (without helping their opponents too much, due to overlapping the Venn diagram prison yard allows).
108088.name: Penguin Panic: The Great Icescape

108089.name: Extreme Edge Volume Two, Issue Seven
108089.description:
The Bleeding Edge!

Is it a magazine for showing Hot Chicks doing Extreme Sports? Or is it a secret communication to the warriors in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind?

Kale Fleigh, the enigmatic editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, isn’t telling. But with any luck, the information in these pages will save the lives of some adventurers, or at least give them the chance to go down fighting!

In this issue...

Cover Girl Taylor Samone: Aerobics Instructor and Kung Fu Warrior!
We Review the Deadeye Systems 10g Pro!
Sierra Devonshire reviews the Band of Blue Fire!
State of the World: Regulations
Editorial: "Exceptional Violence"




When you live on the Extreme Edge, you’re always a razor blade’s width away from catastrophe... and you need a magazine that understands you. Welcome to the Extreme Edge!

(This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game. You will need the Core Rulebook to play.)

108090.name: The Book of Glorious Joy
108090.description:
From the back of the book:

Swords For Malkion

This book gives an overview of the Gloranthan West, with a focus on the heroic kingdom of Loksalm. Here adventurous souls seek the joy of the heart and rise from the rank of peasant to the lofty heights of wizard-knight.

108091.name: Villain-Net
108091.description:
from the back of the PDF

Click Here to Conquer Tomorrow

When someone wants to engage in villainy, where do they go to get started? It isn’t as if there’s a course at the local community college on how to be a villain.

There’s a new on-line resource, though, that is sweeping across the whole of the Earth of 2015. Welcome to Villain-Net, the one-stop-shop for all of the needs of the up-and-coming villain! Bases, minions, gear, even uniforms and new powers. Villain-Net can supply you with whatever you need, for no cash up front. What’s the catch?

If you have the courage to click on the link, you may just find out.

Villain-Net is the supplement of Villainy of all kinds, featuring:


Random Villain Generation: From their style and personality quirks to their secret villain base!
Random Villainous Acts Generation: What crime would you like to commit today?
New Abilities: Cyberware, Martial Arts, Magic, Psionics, and Super Powers for your villainy, and maybe even for your Player Characters!
New Equipment: Weapons too big for the average man to carry and gear that today’s villains need to stay competitive!
Minions, Minions, Minions!: Specialized minions of all sorts, creatures to be magically summoned or raised, and the unique robotic servants of Villain-Net itself - so much Stuff to Beat Up that you’ll need to start early!


The heroes in the war for the future and destiny of mankind are in for the fight of their lives, and the temptation of a lifetime.

Villain-Net is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The RPG. You will need the Core Rulebook to play.

108092.name: Crossword Dice
108092.description:
Object of the game is try Your skill with words to win the greatest number of crossword cards.

In his turn player throws the 6 dice and attempts to form a word(s). If the player can use all six letters then he takes the top card of the card pile but he can only keep it if he can join it to his dice arrangement by forming another word or extending the excisting word.

When all the cards have been claimed the player with the most cards is the winner.

108094.name: Villain-Net 2: Darker Villainy
108094.description:
From the Introduction


Villains are, by definition, bad people. It’s a given that they’re doing bad things at any given point in time; usually hurting people or taking things that don’t belong to them.

In Villain-Net, we explored many avenues of villainy. There are, after all, a huge variety of crimes that one can commit to be considered a villain. The work of evil is broad and varied, and has many faces.

Some super villains have a certain mystique to them - they follow certain codes and guidelines, and can even seem noble in their pursuits. Others, however, have a dark and vicious core. Their personalities are horrid to the extreme, and their villainy exceeds the crimes they commit to infuse every moment of their existence.

Some villains live for their Inner Darkness, and use the basest, most evil aspects of their sexuality to enhance their villainy, and vice versa.

Villain-Net is all about supporting that kind of thing. It exists to help people damn themselves, after all, and nothing is more damning, in the long run, than when one falls to their own Inner Darkness and transcends mere villainy to become a true monster.

108095.name: Clipper Dice
108095.description:
Object of the game is to throw a series of dice combinations to win.

In his turn player throw 5 dice and one of the combination, as shown on the cards appears. He may choose it or try a higher combination re-throwing some of his dice. If he fails he cannot then claim the original combination he abandoned.
If he was successful the next player must attempt the combination re-throwing his dice up to three time.

108096.description:
Crucible of Steel is a scenario pack that focuses solely on the southern shoulder of Operation Citadel. It definitely captured the feel of Kursk, and the scenarios have a wide variety of actions. There are mid to larger scenarios, and there are also numerous tournament- sized scenarios.

32 scenarios
3 New Double-Wide map boards
3 New Standard map boards
2 NEW countersheets for Kursk
4 updated countersheets from Blood and Jungle
1/2 updated countersheet from Operation Cobra
Magazine with detailed articles
Vehicle and Ordnance Notes
Rules pages
108096.name: Crucible of Steel

108097.name: Confrontation Scenarios Volume 1
108097.description:
User Summary

Confrontation Scenarios volume 1 represents an expansion for the "Confrontation" game and includes four additional scenarios set in actual 20th century battlegrounds.

108098.name: Confrontation Scenarios Volume 2
108098.description:
User Summary

Confrontation Scenarios volume 2 represents the second expansion for the master game "Confrontation" and adds an additional four scenarios set in actual 20th century battlegrounds.

108099.name: Death in Russia 1941
108099.description:
User Summary

Death in Russia 1941 is a graphic wargame, accurately depicting operation Barbarossa, the German invasion of Russia. It simulates the whole of the Eastern Front between 1941 and 1943.

108100.name: Total Mania
108100.description: Total mania is a party game.Each player has time in his turn to describe a word to his teamplayers using many different ways such as drawing,body talk,stand up comedy etc.

108101.name: Lost City
108101.description: You and your guide travel through the jungle in search of map pieces that will lead to LOST CITY and the priceless DIAMOND. Return to Safari Village with the diamond and you WIN the game.

108102.name: Crimson Shoals
108102.description:
Adventure Overview (from front of scenario):

Caught in a tumultuous storm en-route to the port city of Messantia, PCs find themselves washed up on a coral reef. They soon discover they are not alone. The crew of the Barachan pirate sloop Zapporo’s Folly has also recently crashed ashore, and sent a party to investigate the nearby wreck of a Stygian galley.

User notes:
This scenario is set in R.E. Howard's Hyborian Age and includes pregenerated characters with appropriate backgrounds and details.
Lemurian Legends: Crimson Shoals is available as a free download from the Strange Stones blog.
A conversion guide for Basic RolePlaying is included in an appendix to the scenario.

108104.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Paint the Townsville Green
108104.description:
From the Back of Game Box

Saving the World before Bedtime.

The Gangreen Gang is on a rampage, spreading their destruction and chaos throughout Townsville! How are you going to stop them?! Well, you could try reason, and tell them the dark path is not the road to self-enlightenment. Or, you could help Buttercup and her sisters track down the Gangreen Gang and administer an old fashioned whoopin'!

Collect hidden electron trading cards and even unlock special hidden features using passcodes!

108105.name: Stormlands: Assault & Capture
108105.description:
Stormlands is a game of area control and combat with specifc set ups and objectives. Relive a historic battle in the ancient land Keldabore, as the Order of the Fire Plains try to reclaim an overthrown castle from the horrifc Dark Forest Cryptids.

This fast, two player game is played out across a standard chess board using Tokens, Dice and a Weather Table. There are multiple ways to win including holding locations and killing specific targets. The unique aspect to this game is the added element of weather, which can be used to blast players off the game board, thus drastically changing the layout of your opponent's defences in a single turn.


The Game Components and Basic Gameplay

Included: 1 Game Board, 40 Tokens (16 Dark Forest Yetis, 16 Order of the Fire Plains, 4 Spawn Location Markers, 4 Objecive Markers), 1 Weather Table, 2 Dice. Suggested use of your own Chess Board.

Characers show a base strength rating of 1-5, that score is augmented by a single die roll which then determines outcomes when attacking and defending your position. Additionally, you each have a Leader and a Weather Master, both hold key powers towards the outcome of each battle. The Weather Table is placed next to the game board, the results from a die roll determine which row is affected and which direction the characers in that row are pushed by the weather. Choose a side, choose a scenario and be the first to accomplish one of your objectives.

108106.name: A Vida Como Ela É
108106.description:
From the Introduction:

Um universo onde nada é sagrado e tudo pode ser corrompido pelo dinheiro e desejo.

A decadência da sagrada família brasileira e de seus costumes foi representa- da pela leva de filmes produzidos nos anos 60-70 que chocaram e esfregaram na cara da sociedade conservadora todas as falhas, desejos e pecados do ser humano. O maior desafio é sair imaculado quando a elite da Zona Sul, com suas festas e orgias, colide com as famílias simples do subúrbio com suas vãs esperanças.

De qualquer forma, no final, as chances que você seja traído, morto, difamado e corrompido são enormes e a tragédia espreita até o mais puro.

Translation:

A universe where nothing is sacred and everything can be corrupted by money and desire.

The decay of the holy family in Brazil and its mores was represented by the wave of films produced in the 60-70 years that have shocked and rubbed in the face of conservative society all the failures, sins and desires of human beings. The biggest challenge is to come out spotless when the elite of the South Zone, with its parties and orgies, collides with simple suburban families with their vain hopes.

Anyway, in the end, the chances that you will be betrayed, killed, defamed and corrupted are enormous and the tragedy stalks even the most pure.

108107.name: Roleplayers Chronicle (Issue 1 - Sep 2011)
108107.description:
Cover by Matthew Meyer

From the introduction:

The goal of Roleplayers Chronicle has always been a simple one: Support the entire industry without bias. This eZine follows that guideline by providing unbiased content concerning every facet of the tabletop role playing industry. This is not an eZine dedicated to one or two game systems or settings. In‐game content will either be developed for universal use (actual game stats will not be given) or a variety of systems will be supported across standard issue release.

108108.name: Improvised Weapons
108108.description:
From Introduction:

In the world of the fantasy adventurer, life is combat. Be it through the use of swords, spells, psionics, or any other means at their disposal, all those who take up the cause of the open road and a sealed dungeon must do battle with another creature and kill it.
End of story.

Combat Options: Improvised Weapons is a sourcebook for the d20 fantasy roleplaying system and is intended as the first is a series of combat-specific material. In here, we shall dive into the tenets of the fighting arts and tread across new, optional rules and variants to the existing system in order to provide these scenes with added realism and strategy. Since all optional material provided in this book will be based on the original combat system laid down in core rulebook I, it is essential to have that book in hand.

108109.name: Get It Wrong To Win
108109.description:
From the website:

Players beware; getting the answers wrong is a lot harder than getting them right. Get it Wrong to Win is the only game where the objective is to give the WRONG answers to the questions. Players attempt to answer five questions with wrong answers before the timer runs out. But watch out, one correct answer and their turn is over. The player with the most tokens wins

108110.name: Damsels in Distress
108110.description:
This is my third game inspired by the Venn diagram. In this game, players choose a fruit cart in the marketplace, and gather the fruit located there. Each carts' contents overlap so taking fruit from the cart affects fruit taken later from the same cart. Using only cards, the Venn idea was definitely abstracted a bit.
In Damsels in Distress, the players are wicked queens/witches that have determined through their talking mirrors, that damsels in the area are more fairer than they. Taking the fruit they poison the apples, feed the monkeys, draw cards, and hinder the prince charming on his way to save the damsel. The apples if given to the damsel before the prince arrives, will put the damsel into a deep sleep (coma). The player who does this will gain the prestige for doing so, of her wicked guild of witches and warlocks. The charming Prince of each Kingdom is headed towards his Kingdom's damsels, and each round saves one, unless hindered (slipping on a banana peel, perhaps? Or better yet, attacked by a band of flying monkeys?). In this community of Witches, there is more prestige for a collection of damsels from different Kingdoms.

108111.name: Avatar Fighter
108111.description:
User Summary
