A fighting game with six avatar characters to choose from, each with a different fighting style and special moves. You are also able to use your own avatar and to choose your moveset. The game plays like Mortal Kombat. After you choose a fighter you will move up a ladder as you defeat opponents in fights and the fights will get harder as you progress.

108112.name: Avatar Laser Wars
108112.description:
User Summary

A third person shooter featuring your avatar as your character. Find ammo and powerups on the battlefield to aid you in battles with up to 16 people. Unlock new weapons as you play.

108113.name: Star Fleet II: Krellan Commander
108113.description:
This sequel to Star Fleet I was published in 1989 by Interstel Corporation, but was only in production for a few months due to internal problems at Interstel. The game was much more complex and sophisticated than SF I. It involved many different ships types, including battlecruisers, destroyers, heavy and light cruisers, frigates, troop transports, freighters, scouts, and starliners. Fleet operations were possible and the universe included hundreds of planets to utilize or conquer. It was only released for DOS.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Fleet (game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108115.name: 3-D Docking Mission
108115.description:
The object of 3-D Docking Mission is to maneuver a spacecraft through an asteroid field and safely dock with its mothership. The ship begins each round with a limited supply of fuel (40 points) which is consumed as the player uses thrusters to pilot the craft. The game ends as a loss if the player's ship runs out of fuel, collides with an asteroid or runs too quickly into the mothership. If the ship reaches the mothership and successfully enters the docking port, the player wins the round and a new one begins with more densely grouped asteroids.

Source: Wikipedia, "3-D Docking Mission", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108116.name: Phasor Zap
108116.description:
Phasor Zap presents the player with a purple-tinted starfield that represents the view from the player's spacecraft. Enemy spacecraft appear from the edges of the screen and move straight across it, and it's up to the player to use to the paddles to focus four "phasor" beams onto each ship to destroy it, earning points. The player begins with a limited amount of phasor energy, one point of which is consumed each time the player shoots. When the amount of remaining energy reaches zero, the phasor is depleted and the game is over.

Source: Wikipedia, "Phasor Zap", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108117.name: Invasion Defense
boardgameversion: English Print and Play first edition
108117.description:
From the rules:
Space jump technology opened the way for humanity to reach to the stars. But soon, exploration ships began to vanish. Hostile eyes had been drawn to earth, and from the void of space, a fleet of deadly ships emerged, intent on our destruction.

The fleets are closing on Earth. Only a handful of hastily assembled ships stand in their path. They must destroy the invaders, or Earth will perish.

A solo or cooperative card game for 1-4 players.

Game description:

Each turn, cards showing Invaders advance on the Earth across three possible different sectors. Each invader ship will add new upgrades and weapons as it approaches the Earth and new cards are drawn to reveal its abilities.

Players then draw and play cards representing the ships and weapons of the Earth fleets. Each ship has a mix of missles, lasers and shields, and most ships have special abilities. Players play ships to different sectors and use them to play missile and shield cards to attack the invaders.

The players must destroy 6 of the invading ships to win. If two invaders get past the fleet, the Earth is destroyed.

108118.name: Trigger Finger
108118.description:
User Summary

A shooter for the Xbox Live Arcade Indie Marketplace. Aim your gun and shoot targets that jump out at you. As you complete levels you will start to face more enemies and you will be able to upgrade your aim and reload speed, your weapon, and unlock grenades.

108119.name: Dreadnoughts (1983)
108119.description:
User Summary

Winter 1914. World War I is well under way. Your fleet of 8 cruisers and 12 destroyers is on a collision course with the enemy fleet. The battle is about to commence! Dreadnoughts is a 1 or 2 player naval tactical wargame and an accurate representation of naval warfare between 1914 and 1918.

108120.name: Das kleine Automobilquiz
108120.description: A small trivia game about cars; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

108121.name: Glob
108121.description:
Positional strategy game originally authored for the Piecepack system where 2-4 players strive to connect a die or pawn orthogonally with a group of exactly five coins (orthogonally connected as well); this group must fulfil an extra condition (two coins matching the suit of the die, three coins matching the suit of the pawn).

The setup is the same for all game configurations: two players use two suits each, three players use their own suit and the remaining suit is used by all, four players use a suit each.

Players can in their turn play any coin onto the board, move any coin on the board over free spaces, or move their own die or pawn over free spaces or coins onto a free space.


The game underwent extensive revision between 2012 and 2013. Some rough edges were smoothed and three new features were added: a procedure for free setups, play on a spherical board and a tactical approach to offering draws.

108124.name: Yacht
108124.description: YACHT is an exciting sailing race built on reality in which wind force and wind direction are of great importance.

108125.name: Professional $tealer
108125.description:
User Summary

A platforming game for the Xbox Live Indie Marketplace. Leap from buildings and avoid cops and obstacles by jumping, sliding, throwing knives, and gaining speed boosts. The game has a checkpoint system in levels if you fall or are caught. The game has leaderboards and supports multiplayer play.

108126.name: Paras
108126.description:
User Summary

Paras is tactical combat game in which you command a parachute force of 15 men and your objective is to cut the enemy line of communication by destroying an important river crossing. You must operate behind enemy lines but, on the bright side, you are well equipped and have an unlimited supply of grenades.

108127.name: Polltics
108127.description:
From the publisher's website and press release:

"A neat mixture of Politics and strategies that gives you control on how intense to play (Casual relaxed social mood or competitive against opponents)."

"The game kicks off as participants choose their favorite VOTE chips and PARTY card along with four PROP cards from the deck. Players then take turns campaigning, purchasing potential votes, and rolling the dice against opponents for State’s Supremacy.

General Elections are called, votes counted, and winners of the Presidency, House/ Senate Majority, and Supreme Court judges are revealed. Players are paid according to the total number of VOTES earned. The cycle continues until someone wins the game by achieving Absolute Majority. Players use strategy to determine which states to campaign in, how much money to spend on a given state, and decide when to pass a BILL to hinder their opponents."

"The game can also be played as a type of POKER in a relaxed setting."

108128.name: Tohgoku-Sohran
108128.description:
Multiplayers game designed by Shibamura Yuhri.
Played with 2 to 5 players.
Covering the Eastern part of Japan during Sengoku era.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sengoku_period
Each player can play one of Takeda, Oda, Uesugi, Imagawa or Hohjoh.
The gamemap covers from Shima to Echigo. This is very unusual game, because the map doesn't have Kyoto.
Victory is assessed by the amount of income from its territory. And the value of each area varies depending on the scenario era.

There are 5 scenarios which cover specific historical campaigns, such as Kawanakajima, Okehazama, Nagasino.
The main rule is only 3 pages.
5 daimyo cards, 1 counter sheet, 1 gamemap, 1 rulebook.

108130.name: Wishtaker
108130.description:
From publisher blurb:


Beware the Wishtaker

When human technology hits a snag, there can be all kinds of Hell to pay. When the Hellish technology that forms Villain-Net goes bad, though, even Hell may have trouble footing the tab.

When the machinations of Hell meet with the spiritual enigma that is the Slimeys, no one could predict that the outcome would be a being so powerful and so dark that it could alter the balance between good and evil itself.

She is called the Wishtaker, and once she takes your wish from you, she has only begun.

This supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game picks up where Villain-Net leaves off , and goes into a dark and horrible place. It also relies on material from our supplements Inner Darkness and Yiffy, Yaoi, and Yahooey!

Readers are cautioned: once the Wishtaker enters your Hot Chicks campaign, no one there may ever be safe again.

108131.name: Hot Chicks 4.1: Ladies of the Night Naked and in Distress
108131.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map - the one you're going to be staring at for the next few hours. Why not fill it with some Hot Chicks?

In Hot Chicks 4: Ladies of the Night, we introduced you to 48 unique and individual women practicing the world's oldest profession, dressed to draw attention and make money. Now, those same 48 women are having a very bad day. In "Hot Chicks 4.1: Ladies of the Night Naked and in Distress," we see the "Ladies of the Night" bereft of their clothing, in poses and with expressions that indicate a situation of menace or danger!

Ideal as victims to populate dungeons, potential sacrifices, window-dressing for sadistic megalomaniacs, or even as figures of PCs having REALLY bad days, these 48 high quality Paper Miniatures (in the 25mm scale) will keep gamers' eyes glued to the battle map for hours at a time.

Nothing motivates a group of PCs to give it their all like a bevy of Hot Chicks, Naked and in Distress!

108132.name: Hot Chicks Artbook 4.1: The Art of Ladies of the Night Naked and in Distress
108132.description:
From publisher blurb:

In our product Hot Chicks 4.1: Ladies of the Night Naked and in Distress, you found 48 women of beauty and skill stripped to their most vulnerable and posed with expressions of terror on their lovely faces. There, they were on 25mm Paper Miniatures. Now, you can see the full-sized graphics in all their glory.

"Hot Chicks Art Book 4.1: The Art of Ladies of the Night Naked and In Distress" includes all images used in Hot Chicks 4.1: Ladies of the Night Naked and in Distress, both front and back images. Ideal for visual aids for the GM and even sketches of PCs having VERY bad days, these images give extra life and depth to the graphics from Hot Chicks 4: Ladies of the Night and the The Hot Chicks Art Book 4: The Art of Ladies of the Night.

"Hot Chicks Art Book 4.1: The Art of Ladies of the Night Naked and In Distress" is more than a collection of our full-sized graphics, though. Included in this book are notes on using Prostitutes in your very own Horror Roleplaying experience. There are notes on how Prostitution and Horror make a natural combination, a section on the interaction of Prostitution and the Supernatural in Horror Roleplaying, and even 16 unique Adventure Seeds to whet the appetite for delving into the world of dark horror and prostitution in your own games!

Written by acclaimed Horror Game Master Scott Corum, these notes will kick up your mature horror roleplaying experience a notch.

108133.name: SWAT Girl
108133.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set features The SWAT Girl from our first paper miniatures set Hot Chicks 1. Also appearing in The Hot Chicks Art Book, she is not only an armored modern warrior or law enforcement, but also has a casual and sensual side.

She is showcased here in 20 new images. She is shown in various states of dress, including armored, duty wear, casual, swimwear, and formal wear. She is shown in various poses and in close up for facial detail.

Useful as an art reference, a visual aid, as character sketches, and as game art.

108134.name: Hot Chicks RPG Free Preview: Terror of the Greygore!
108134.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a peek inside the world of HOT CHICKS: The Roleplaying Game! The Free Preview includes a Seven Page comic, a horiffic set of villains, usable Player Characters, and an adventure of truly catastrophic proportions!

Have a read, kick the tires. Folks who already own HOT CHICKS: The RPG will find the information invluable for new adventures.

108135.name: ...And Then There Were Ten
108135.description:
From publisher blurb:


Murder Most Foul

Eleven people find themselves trapped in an isolated hotel. Elven people go to bed, but only ten will ever wake up again.

It's time for a good old fashioned murder mystery, Hot Chicks style! Here are ten fully realized characters from all walks of life. Use them as allies, adversaries, contacts, love interests... or involve them in a classic murder mystery scenario.

Included are guidelines for running a murder mystery, and an open-ended mystery. Who did it?

You're going to have to work that out for yourselves... technically, it could have been any of them.

108136.name: Cocaine
108136.description: A game in which the players act as drug lords competing to have the reputation for supplying the best drugs. Players bid for turn order, action selection, and a bonus privilege, jointly. Actions include producing drugs, distributing drugs to dealers, and influencing the number of sales a particular dealer makes. Player identity is secret and players take the above actions in such a way that drugs sold by dealers they are associated with are of higher quality than those of their opponents.

108138.name: Karla Ford
108138.description:
From publisher blurb:


Not Just a Pretty Face

Karla Ford was once the best Data Warfare operative the Army had to offer. When a suicide bomber in an exploding truck destroyed her heart, everyone thought she was out of the game.

When you have friends like Kale Fleigh, the editor of Extreme Edge Magazine, though, you're never as far out of the game as people might think. With a little help from Nth Degree, the outlaw organization that aids and supplies cyborgs, Karla found a new lease on life - a high performance artificial heart, and data warfare assets that the military couldn't match.

Now, she runs a fetish website on the side, but spends the majority of her time as T@ru$, the most dangerous hacker on the planet.

A character study, gallery of character images, and homage all in one, this Character Spotlight introduces Karla Ford to the world of Hot Chicks, and provides a powerful ally in the battle for the future and destiny of mankind.

Be warned, though... some might find Karla too hot to handle!

108139.name: Spinaroo
108139.description:
Goal:
Spinning the tops score as many points as possible

1. Determine sequence of players
- each player spins a top on the board;
the one who scores most (ends up in the highest
compartment) starts ...
2. Use 3 tops - spin them one at a time in rapid succession
in the center square of the box/board - no delay
allowed, immediately you have to spin the following during
the other(s) are in action
3. After the three tops have come to stop ==> scoring takes
place (= numbers of the compartments in which the tops rest)
4. The player who first scores 100 points, wins the game

108140.name: Chloe, the Martial Artist
108140.description:
From publisher blurb:

Her name is Chloe Barbosa. She was born in Russia, orphaned young, and adopted by a family of Ju Jitsu instructors. It wasn’t an easy life, but it got harder.
She’s not entirely sure how it came to pass that she started fighting the supernatural. Aliens, demons, cyborgs... now it’s all a blur of one fight after the other. That’s what happens, though, when you’re in the world of HOT CHICKS.
This is the first in a series of Character Studies... detailed examinations of characters that occupy the back alleys and shadows of the world of HOT CHICKS: The Roleplaying Game. Included are over forty images of Chloe in various stages of dress, including none at all. She’s quite proud of all the tattoos...
Read her history, study her form, and view her statistics. She makes an ideal NPC companion, ally, and is also perfectly suitable as a Player Character.

108141.name: Rapture: The End of Days
108141.description:
From the publisher:

The year is 2644. Humanity has cast off religion and mi­grated to the stars. With science as the new savior, man­kind believed himself to be creating new Edens in the far flung heavens.
But God kept His promise. The day of Rapture came.

Those who walked the Earth with a righteous spirit and pure soul were taken into the loving arms of the Lord. Those who skulked with the devil, ignoring God’s divine laws, have been cast aside to face the horrors awaiting all sinners. As promised, the Earth burned. The clouds evap­orated. The rule of man, of reason and science, came to an end.

But that was on Earth.

And not all of Mankind was on Earth.

These far flung few who remain, forgotten by God, or per­haps given a second chance, now face a future where good and evil have come into sharp relief; where science has proven to be a false idol, yet one that is vital for survival.

With communications between colonies severed, no one knows for sure what has befallen humanity. The isolated pockets of human colonists are returning to the old ways – political squabbling, superstition and factional infighting are on the rise. As a tide of distrust rises among the survi­vors, unexplainable horrors are emerging.

The legions of Satan are real...

And they are coming for you.

Rapture is a pen-and-paper role-playing game of dark theological sci-fi horror. An innovative narrative-style rule system lets your focus on creating plots and terror. Ev­erything needed to run a game is included: character cre­ation, core rules, a detailed and realistic future world set­ting, politics, technology, foes, and even story seeds and tips for the Game Master.

108142.name: Neirya the Gun Goddess
108142.description:
From publisher blurb:

Her name is Neirya Blajeny. She was born to parents who performed in a travelling carnival, and became a master marks-person by the time she was eight.

It was the day that her father died that she began fighting the Supernatural. Aliens, demons, cyborgs... now it’s all a blur of one fight after the other. That’s what happens, though, when you’re in the world of HOT CHICKS.

This is the second in a series of Character Studies... detailed examinations of characters that occupy the back alleys and shadows of HOT CHICKS: The Roleplaying Game. Included are over forty images of Neirya in various stages of dress, including none at all. She may not have had a good relationship since... well, ever, but there’s always hope!

Read her history, study her form, and view her statistics. She makes an ideal NPC companion, ally, and is also perfectly suitable as a Player Character.

108143.name: Suzette, The Psionicist
108143.description:
From publisher blurb:

Her name is Suzette Trianne. She was an normal young girl, until her psychic powers manifested in a fiery day of devastation and terror.

She was saved by the enigmatic organization known as Demna, who valed her for her psionic talents, trained her, and recruited her to be one of their potent psychic enforcers. That's what happens, though, when you're in the world of HOT CHICKS.

This is the third in a series of Character Studies... detailed examinations of characters that occupy the back alleys and shadows of the Earth of 2015. Included are over thirty images of Suzette in various stages of dress, including none at all. She may have a bad track record of relationships going down in flames, but there's always hope!

Read her history, study her form, and view her statistics. She makes an ideal NPC companion, ally, and is also perfectly suitable as a Player Character.

108144.name: Eve Sylver
108144.description:
From publisher blurb:

Her name is Eve Sylver. She was created to be an arrogant scientist's showpiece and personal toy.

When she realized that her fate was to be nothing more than a means to satisfy his ego and other lusts, she murdered her creator, and fled to live on the streets, where she is constantly in danger from criminals, demons, aliens, and a murderous AI that wants her body for all the wrong reasons. That's what happens, though, when you're in the world of HOT CHICKS.

This is the fourth in a series of Character Studies... detailed examinations of characters that occupy the back alleys and shadows of the Earth of 2015. Included are over fifty images of Eve in various stages of dress, including none at all. She may not have had a good relationship since... well, ever, but there's always hope!

Read her history, study her form, and view her statistics. She makes an ideal NPC companion, ally, and is a beautiful complication for your Hot Chicks games.

108145.name: Ori Velasquez
108145.description:
From publisher blurb:

Her name is Orinda Velasquez. Her family tried to protect her from a history of violence, but they could only protect her for so long.

When the path to vengeance led only to a humiliating defeat, her father called in some favors, and that's when her life got very interesting. She went from being a world-famous swimsuit model to a woman of action overnight.

That's what happens, though, when you're in the world of HOT CHICKS.

This is the fifth in a series of Character Studies... detailed examinations of characters that occupy the back alleys and shadows of the Earth of 2015. Included are over forty images of Ori in various stages of dress and imperilment.

Read her history, study her form, and view her statistics. She makes an ideal NPC companion, ally, and is a beautiful complication for your Hot Chicks games.

108146.name: Rapture Essentials: The Players Handbook
108146.description:
From the introduction:

The mini-rulebook contains the basic rules for playing Mortals - the brave men and women who were unlucky enough to be in space when the Rapture came. This book is designed as a quick reference for new players or Game Masters (GMs) that want to print out the core rules for use at a gaming table. The Rapture: End of Days Core Rulebook contains more details and examples of how these rules can be used during the game, and it is strongly recommended that at the very least the Game Master has a copy of that book. Even so, this handy mini-rulebook will give you all the basics needed to play in the Rapture universe.

108147.name: Deadlier Than The Male
108147.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you have a threatened population, you'll find members of that population evolving into a response to that threat. When you're threatening the Hot Chicks of Earth in 2015, you're going to eventually have to deal with some truly bad ass Hot Chicks.

Here are ten of them. Suitable for use as Player Charcters, allies, adversaries, contacts, complications... when you need dangerous hot chicks in your Hot Chicks game, here they are.

Everything from the magic-using arsonist to the combat-ready cyborg, these ladies will mess you up something fierce.

We've seen a lot of dangerous people In the world of Earth in 2015 - aliens, demons, robots, ninjas - and they've all proven dangerous, even deadly.

But the female of the speicies is more deadly than the male.

These characters can be used in a number of ways. They're balanced to be reasonable starting characters, so they can even be used as PC's. They make excellent allies and contacts, perhaps as potential relationships for PC's.

Then again, they can also be used as opponents - complications and even campaign villains.

Also included are some glamour shots of a number of the characters, because it wouldn't be a proper salute to Hot Chicks without seeing them in all their glory.

108148.name: Doctor Vore 2
108148.description:
From publisher blurb:

From our Pre-Hot Chicks product line, we bring Doctor Vore into the world of the Earth of 2015. His one life's dream, to feed the starving masses of the Earth TO the starving masses of the Earth has progressed nicely, and he is poised on the edge of creating the most perfect food ever made... made of people, that is!

But things are not all as they seem, and even a cruel and inhuman criminal organization bent on rendering helpless people down to nutrients can have darker secrets.

Doctor Vore 2 is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game. It includes game statistics for the Doctor and his close associates, his minions, and some standard random victims. More, it includes more tentacles for Tentacle Monsters, the Super Powers that allow a character to create these tentacles on their own, and some of the most bizarre and dangerous twists and turns yet encountered in Hot Chicks.

Evil. It's what's for dinner.

boardgameimplementation: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Suppressed Memories – Figure and Tile Collection
108150.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Inside abandoned hospitals, secret laboratories, and forgotten cellars, scientists are conducting depraved experiments that will drag humanity to the brink of the abyss. Only a small group of investigators can discover the truth and put an end to these mad plots before it's too late...

Mansions of Madness: Forbidden Alchemy provides players with new investigators for the Mansions of Madness base game, as well as new Trauma, Mythos, and Combat cards for use in any story. Forbidden Alchemy also includes three new scenarios, in which investigators will encounter new rooms, monsters, items, clues, locks, and obstacles:


In "Return of the Reanimator", the investigators are tasked with entering a vermin-infested manor to seek the whereabouts of Doctor Herbert West, a reportedly insane scientist whose legendary experiments in reanimation led to his untimely demise.



"Yellow Matter" tells the grim tale of research into strange extraterrestrial beings. But who is the experimenter, and who is the subject?



"Lost in Time and Space" takes your Mansions of Madness experience to mind-bending new heights with the introduction of time travel! Travel back to the mid-nineteenth century or ahead to the mid-twenty-first in your search for the truth behind a strange and dangerous device.


With four new investigators, two monster types, nearly 250 new cards, 40 tokens and markers, and six detailed map tiles, Forbidden Alchemy introduces a host of new enhancements to your Mansions of Madness experience.

The revised printing of Mansions of Madness: Forbidden Alchemy, scheduled for release in May 2012, includes corrected cards and map set-ups for all three scenarios.
108150.name: Mansions of Madness: Forbidden Alchemy
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 49- Panamax and Board Game Confessions

108151.name: MAS-WWII Plane Pack #1
108151.description:
This first official expansion for MAS-WWII adds 11 new aircraft:

Netherlands
D.XXI
G.1A

Poland
P.11C
P.23B Karas
P.37B Los

Commonwealth
A-20 Wirraway
Halifax Mk. I
A-46 Boomerang

Germany
Me.323 Gigant
Hs.129B
Me.410A

108152.name: Salt Lake 2002
108152.description:
Salt Lake 2002 is the official video game of the XIX Olympic Winter Games, hosted by Salt Lake City, United States in 2002. Developed by ATD and published by Eidos (DC Studios Inc./UbiSoft for the Game Boy Advance version), it was released for the PC, PlayStation 2 and Game Boy Advance.
Following the success of Sydney 2000, Eidos trusted the Olympic license once again to ATD. The game uses the same graphic style and presentation of the previous game, only with more details. However, while Sydney 2000 managed good sales and positive reviews, Salt Lake 2002 failed to achieve either. The lack of crucial and popular events such as cross-country, biathlon, speed skating or figure skating, combined with only six events (of which 3 involve gates) turned the game into another flop based on the Winter Olympics.
Competition

There are four game modes: Olympic, Tournament, Classic and Time Trial. The Olympic Mode returns to the simplistic direct-to-competition mode, unlike Sydney 2000 that forced the player to qualify for the Olympics. Each players' victories are logged, and trophies/medals can be seen in a trophy room.
Gameplaywise, the events are unevenly done. While the downhill/slalom events are reasonably simulated and playable (one can play downhill in first person view, and at easier levels missing a gate in the slalom does not disqualify the player), in ski jump and bobsleigh results are generally hard to predict or control.

Source: Wikipedia, "Salt Lake 2002 (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108153.name: Things to Do #1: Raid the Peril Pits of Doctor Vore
108153.description:
From publisher blurb:

You've got characters, you've got monsters, you've got a time to game. Now what do you need? Like all heroes, you need Things to Do!

Here you will find adventure seeds, nefarious villains, henchmen, even nubile victims to rescue! Every character described is presented in BOTH 25mm Miniature scale, as paper Standees, AND in full-size graphics for visual aids!

In This Installment - Women have been going missing in your city at an alarming rate. The police and the media refuse to acknowledge the problem. Could it be that a mad scientist is kidnapping victims of his horrific plot to create a new food source out of PEOPLE?

Face down the mad Doctor Vore and rescue his helpless victims! Deal with his lethal accomplices, his armored goons, and his twisted attempt to turn the skeletons of his past victims into robotic soldiers!

Includes thirty (30!) paper standees in 25mm scale, three villanous flat terrain features, full-sized graphics of each and every standee, adventure seeds, story ideas, and more!

Are you looking to gain experience and defeat evil? Then you need THINGS TO DO!

108154.name: Sennen Kazoku
108154.description:
Sennen Kazoku (千年家族 Thousand Year Family?) is a life simulation game developed by Indieszero and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Game Boy Advance. It was released only in Japan.
Gameplay

Players begin by playing as Cupit, who have been asked by God to protect a particular family from dangers. Players spend their time in the game meddling in the lives of members of the family. The family members move about on their own, but players can shoot them with emotion arrows which change their actions, examples being "Work Hard Arrow" and "Calm Down Arrow." The goal of the game is to keep the family going over multiple generations, perhaps spanning a thousand years (hence the name).
The game action is viewed from the side, with players looking into the family's home as big headed characters move about. To meddle in the path of a character, players merely select an emotion arrow from a menu and aim at the character. To help in the family management, players have quick access to stats about each member of the family along with a family tree. The game helps out by keeping an up-to-date listing all off happenings within the family.
Sennen Kazoku makes use of the Game Boy Advance's internal clock. Even when the Game Boy Advance is off, the family will keep evolving. Players have to be sure and turn on your Game Boy Advance every now and then, or you'll miss key events.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sennen Kazoku", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108155.description:
Fox's Party is a fast playing push your luck and memory game in one. Each player starts with a deck of twelve face-down cards, each card shows one of seven animals on it, but since those cards are face-down you don't know which animals you have, at least not at first.

The remaining cards are placed face up in the center of the table so that everyone can see the critter on the top card; the face of each card also shows a "size chart" of how the animals relate to one another in size: the ant is the smallest, followed by the snail, the frog, the hedgehog, the fox, the deer and the bear.

On a turn, you state whether you think the card on top your deck features an animal that's larger, smaller, or the same size as the animal on top of the deck, then you reveal that card.

If you're wrong, you place the card face down on the bottom of your deck and end your turn.

If you're correct, you can stop or decide to take another guess, but this time you'll compare the hidden animal on top of your deck with the animal that you just revealed.

Anytime you're wrong, you bury all revealed cards in the same order face down under your deck. But if you stop after one or more correct answers, you then place all of those cards (in the order guessed) on top of the central deck.

The first player to play all the cards in his deck wins.
108155.name: Fox's Party
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Zoch Verlag

108156.description:
Are you ready to pick up a bargain? You can get as many goods as you want, but you can't take more than Aunt Trudel will allow you to take – and she's a bit of a weirdo when it comes to making sales. If your goods weigh more than the goods that Aunt Trudel has set aside, then you get nothing!

In Tante Trudels Trödel, players shop from a 5x5 array of goods, each with their own basket. One item – a coat hanger, a vase, a dollhouse couch – is placed on most of the spaces in the array, while a few spaces are covered with vouchers. Three items are set aside at random, and those are the goods that Aunt Trudel will weigh at checkout to see whether you'd met her tough standards.

All players start on the same corner of the game board with a shopping basket. On a turn, a player rolls a die, moves her basket that many spaces around the game board in a clockwise direction, then picks up one item (or voucher) from the row that her basket is next to and places it in her basket. If a player's basket lands on the same location as an opponent's basket, then the player can take an item from the opponent instead. If a player picks up a voucher, she can exchange it later for another item on the board, putting the voucher in its place, in addition to taking an item. The first player to circle the board has the option of then moving counter-clockwise to pick up more goods; everyone else is finished once they circle the game board.

Each player in turn then weighs her goods against Aunt Trudel's holdings using the funky cardboard scale included in the box. If your goods weight more than Trudel's, you're out; if not, then you're still in the game. Of those players, whoever has the heaviest goods wins!
108156.name: Tante Trudels Trödel
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Zoch Verlag

boardgamehonor: 2012 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
108157.description:
In Kalimambo, players are amateur explorers in Africa, excited about the discovery of a new species, one of whose members – dubbed "Kali" by the explorers – playfully runs amongst the group as it crosses the savannah. Unbeknownst to the group, Kali's rhinoceros friend Mambo is eager to bump the group along to keep it moving, possibly pushing an explorer or two into the dung heaps that dot the land. Can you avoid getting a faceful of feces and being bumped by Mambo?

To set up the game, one player places Mambo on a space on the track that circles the game board, then all of the explorer tokens placed in random order in front of it, then Kali placed at the head of the line. Place the dung heaps along the movement track with some space between them. Each player takes a set of movement cards that match the color of her explorer.

Each player secretly chooses a movement card, then they reveal these cards simultaneously; someone also reveals the top movement card from Kali's deck. Whichever player has played the highest card moves her explorer token to the first unoccupied space in front of the group, then the player with the next highest card moves her token, and so on. If two or more players reveal the same number, only the one farthest back in the group moves; all other such explorers remain where they started the round. (Kali moves like an explorer. If you play a zero or are at the front of the group when you are supposed to move, you don't move.)

If a player's token lands on a dung heap, she scores three penalty points. If Kali lands in the dung, the player(s) who played the lowest number that round take the penalty instead of Kali.

Whenever Kali or an explorer token leave the space immediately in front of Mambo, the rhino charges, moving until it rams into the token in back of the line and giving that player as many penalty points as the number of spaces Mambo ran. If Mambo rams Kali, then as with the Kali/dung interaction, the player(s) who played the lowest number take the penalty points instead of Kali.

Remove those played movement cards from the game. After twelve rounds – that is, after the final cards have been played and resolved, the game ends and the player with the fewest points wins.
108157.name: Kalimambo
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Zoch Verlag

108158.description:
Another entry in Zoch Verlag's family of cute animal games, Wollmilchsau is a speedy reaction game in which you want to name the right animal on a turn – but which animal is right may be harder to determine than you think.

To set up, shuffle the deck of animal cards, then divide it into two face-up piles of cards; each card shows one of six animals: mouse, cat, dog, sheep, pig, or cow (from smallest to largest). Take one card from the top of one deck, and insert it face-down halfway through that deck.

All players compete at the same time. One player rolls a die that has one of the six animals on each face. The first player to yell out the name of the animal rolled will score – except if that animal is on one of the face-up cards; in this case, players must yell out one of the animals not visible on the top of the decks, with the first player doing so scoring – except for the final rule for animal calling, that being that the animal named correctly in the previous round cannot be called out in the current round, even if it would otherwise be correct. If two or more players yell an animal's name correctly at the same time, they all score. (The largest correct animal is the one that players cannot name in the subsequent round.)

If you score, you either:

Take one card from the top of one face-up deck and place it in front of you, or
Turn all the face-up cards in front of you face down to make them safe.




Safe for what, you may ask? If you call out an animal incorrectly, you must discard all face-up cards in front of you; if you have no face-up cards, then you must turn one safe card (if you have any) face up to put it at risk again.

Once the face-down card in the deck appears, you split this deck to create a third face-up pile, increasing the difficulty of the game. Once all the cards have been claimed, the game ends and the player with the most cards wins.
108158.name: Wollmilchsau
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Zoch Verlag

108159.description:
In Schnapp's players need to guess which tiles on the table they need to slap to claim – but they might have a tough time interpreting what the target is as the cluegiver must do things like speak with his fingers between his teeth or hop around the table on one leg. Schnapp to it!

To set up the game, lay out the 96 picture tiles face up so that they can be seen by all players. Each player receives a task card; this task card shows nine pictures that its holder will have to describe, a challenging task since the 96 pictures are grouped into 16 different families, with each family consisting of six very similar images.

In each round, the player to the left of the active player starts the sandtimer, then the active player looks at his task card and begins to describe the icons and pictures on it for the player two spots to his left. He cannot show his card, point to tiles, or answer the searcher's questions; he can change which item he's describing at any time. The searcher can only say things like "Done!" or "Got it!" to spur the active player on to describe something new. Once the time runs out, both describer and searcher score points for all correct items grabbed, then those items are returned to the table.

After everyone has been the active player once, the second round begins, with the active player first drawing a handicap card that imposes some condition on him while he gives clues to the same searcher as before. For the third round, the describer and searcher switch roles, with the new describer also having a handicap. After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

The rulebook for Schnapp's includes a few variants, such as one in which three people search for matching pictures at the same time and a fully cooperative game.
108159.name: Schnapp's
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Zoch Verlag

108160.name: Evolution of the Ebon Fur
108160.description:
From publisher blurb:


His Name is Nrak, But You Can Call Him...


...the Ebon Fur!

As evil endures, it grows and changes. So it is the case with the Ebon Fur - no longer truly Furry, not really a Slimey, but a new and horrible thing all of his own, dedicated to fear and pain in a way that nothing before him has ever been.

Follow the fate of his victims and see what has become of Nrak since we last saw him... learn of his new and terrible powers, and see what lengths the Furries are prepared to go to in order to see that his threat is removed from the face of the Earth.

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game. It is a sequel to the supplement Rampage of the Ebon Fur, and like the original, draws heavily on material from Yiffy, Yaoi, and Yahooey! and Inner Darkness, as well as referencing Inner Darkness 2: The Depravity War.

108161.description:
Aquileia, the second most important city of the Roman Empire, had been originally founded as an outpost against the Barbarian invaders. From its military origin comes the peculiar quadrilateral structure divided by the main streets. Later, the city developed to become an important political and cultural center and a prosperous trading city, especially for precious goods, thanks to its convenient and efficient river port. Important monuments such as the Gladiator Arena, the horse-racing Stadium, and the famous theater were built, as well as craftsmen's workshops, patrician villas which completed the architectural network of the city.

In Aquileia, players want to become the most powerful figure in the city by trading and building. Each player, representing a wealthy Aquileian patrician, owns a certain number of henchmen (pawns) which he uses for these main activities: sports playing, culture, trading, and building. Each activity can bring expenses, earnings and sometimes victory points (VPs).

Each round begins with a placement phase in which players take turns placing their henchmen on action spaces and their tiebreaker disc on the tiebreaker track. Placing the tiebreaker is mandatory; placing henchmen is not (but you probably want to place them). Once everyone has passed or placed all of their tokens, players resolve the action spaces in numerical order:


The Mercatus allows players to buy weapons, arms and slave cards, collect money through a die roll, claim four blue dice for use with the Arena and Stadium, and trade one currency for another. (This is the only way to make change, and some actions require specific currencies; if you must pay bronze and have only silver and gold, then you cannot take that action!)
At the Arena, players compare fighting strength, with that number determined by the starting strength on the action space claimed, the roll of three dice and the playing of slave and weapon cards. The winner gets three bronze coins and either double his strength in VPs or a slave card. The second and third best players receive lesser rewards.
The Stadium is similar to the Arena, with the horse cards coming into play and the winner receiving gold or silver coins and his choice of two laurel cards; laurel cards deliver 3-10 VPs or are a multiplier for endgame scoring.
The Theatrum brings a bid for a dual-colored laurel card, with players needing to ante and raise in particular currencies.
In the Forum, players build villas and private banks, sometimes scoring points for doing so when they pay the specific costs with the proper coins.
Finally, the Portus gives players a chance to activate their buildings, thereby earning them VPs or money.


After six rounds, the game ends and players score VPs for their hidden point cards and the product of their villas' values times laurel cards of a matching color. (For example, a total of 8 points of blue villas and three blue villa cards equals 24 points.) The player with the most victory points wins.
108161.name: Aquileia
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Zoch Verlag

108162.name: FurFolio
108162.description:
From publisher blurb:


They Are The Furries

More specifically, here are the full game statistics for all of the Furries depicted throughout Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game - well, all but three, but those guys didn't make it.

Each character has an art study, notes and background, and are fully "statted out," usable as Player Characters or NPCs in your Hot Chicks game. Delve into deeper secrets of the mysterious Furries in their shadow war against the Slimeys, and see what role the rest of mankind has to play in this battle for their own soul

The seminal sample characters from Yiffy, Yaoi, and Yahooey! are also included, with a few improvements. Furries get experience too, after all!

There are twenty-eight (28!) complete characters in all, with specialities ranging from Archaeology to Zombie hunting. Populate the dark corners and deep places of the Earth in 2015 with Fur, Scales, and Feathers, and see just who the real animals are!

108163.name: Girl Next Door 1
108163.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set features the girl next door (1) from our first paper miniatures set Hot Chicks 1. Also appearing in The Hot Chicks Art Book, she is not only in her street casual clothing, but is also presented dressed for clubbing and in intimate wear.

She is showcased here in 20 new images. She is shown in various states of dress, including street, club wear, and lingerie. She is shown in various poses and in close up for facial detail.

Useful as an art reference, a visual aid, as character sketches, and as game art.

108164.name: Girls Next Door 2 & 3
108164.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set features the girls next door (3 & 4) from our first paper miniatures set Hot Chicks 1. Also appearing in The Hot Chicks Art Book, they are not only in their casual clothing, but is also presented dressed for clubbing and in intimate wear.

They are showcased here in 10 new images each (20 images total). They are shown in various states of dress, including street, club wear, and lingerie. They are shown in various poses and in close up for facial detail.

Useful as an art reference, a visual aid, as character sketches, and as game art.

108165.name: Action Chick
108165.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set features the Action Chick from our first paper miniatures set Hot Chicks 1. Also appearing in The Hot Chicks Art Book, she is not only in her Action Gear, but is also presented dressed in street gear and in intimate apparel.

She is showcased here in 20 new images. She is shown in various states of dress, including street, action wear, and lingerie. She is shown in various poses and in close up for facial detail.

Useful as an art reference, a visual aid, as character sketches, and as game art.

108166.name: Serious Sam Advance
108166.description:
Serious Sam Advance is a spin-off for the Game Boy Advance. The game features Egypt and Rome as settings, new graphical style, and many enemies and weapons returning from The First Encounter and The Second Encounter. The game introduces many new, exclusive enemies and weapons. The story resolves around Sam going back in time again as a group of people studying ancient civilizations in the Earth's past encounters new forces of Mental's hybrid army. Sam has to return to Egypt first, and then proceed to Rome, battling hordes of enemies on his way. The game's bosses (each one encountered at the end of two settings) are two similar-looking lychantroph-like commanders: Sirian Sphinx (Egypt) and Wolfiator (Rome). With the defeat of the latter, Sam Stone, again victorious, finally returns to his time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Serious Sam Advance", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

108167.name: Lanya
108167.description:
From publisher blurb:

This set features Lanya from our first paper miniatures set Hot Chicks 1. Also appearing in The Hot Chicks Art Book, she is not only in her street casual clothing, but is also presented dressed for clubbing and in intimate wear.

She is showcased here in 20 new images. She is shown in various states of dress, including street, club wear, and lingerie. She is shown in various poses and in close up for facial detail.

Useful as an art reference, a visual aid, as character sketches, and as game art.

108168.name: Labyrinth of the LIZARDROIDS
108168.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mars Challenge offered a tremendous prize to the corporation best able to develop a system to explore and colonize Mars, and Wolcott Industries had the best and most brilliant idea.

Create Artificial Intelligences based off the lizard brain - natural desert survivors! Give them mostly humanoid bodies so they could prepare a human colony, make them tough enough to survive the trip to Mars and the brutal, rugged exploration of its surface, give them the ability to carve through rock, smelt metal, and produce the machines that mankind would need, and you have a force capable of making the red planet our home before we even step foot on it!

Pity they accidentaly got turned on while they were on Earth... just outside your home city.

Explore the complex carved under your city before it collapses under the weight of the buildings in a catastrophe of bibilical proportions! Meet and fight ten different varieties of Lizardroid, each more dangerous than the last! And meet the enigmatic Solomon Wolcott - brilliant industrialist and cold-blooded murderer!

Someone does need to fix these little problems, from time to time... that's why thereare Player Characters!

108169.name: Return of the Cyberlich
108169.description:
From publisher blurb:


Bad Ideas Are Forever

When one of the brightest minds in Science is horribly wronged by the corporations that want to exploit his work, he goes back through his catlog of failures (most of them Major Malfunctions of the past), and combines them into a bad idea on legs. The result? A spree of serial killings the likes of which the world has never seen before.

Sometimes, the Major Malfunction is in the technology itself. Sometimes, though, the technology works exactly as it is expected to - the malfunction is in the people who put it together to begin with, or worse, in the society that made them what they are.

Bring big guns and prepare to see some horrors; the Cyberlich is out there, and no one is safe.

Please be advised: This book contains nudity and disturbing imagery.

There will be material referenced from the supplements Bios Ex Nihilum and Inner Darkness as well. We will also be revisiting the previous Major Malfunction titles; Major Malfunctions #1: Rogue Cyborg, Major Malfunctions #2: Mall of the Future, and Major Malfunctions #3: Labyrinth of the LIZARDROIDS. We'll also revisit some of the material in Doctor Vore 2... if you're building an engine of revenge, you pull out ALL the stops.

Someone does need to fix these problems, from time to time... that's why there are Player Characters!

108170.name: Mechaphisto: The Demon Lord of Technology
108170.description:
From publisher blurb:


His Name is Mechaphisto

He is woven throughout our history. He is inspiration and temptation. He is our muse and our tormentor. He is Mechaphisto; the Demon Lord of Technology, and he wants the souls of mankind.

For the first time in the history of Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game, we offer this insight into the workings of Hell itself. See how the hierarchy of demons is established, exactly what they want human souls for, and what they do with them. Learn dark secrets of human history, and peek behind the scenes of the infernal connection between mankind's sudden leaps in inspiration, and mankind's damnation.

And while you're at it, Mechaphisto has an offer for criminals, governments, and Adventurers of all kinds. Oh, it isn't much - just a tiny little device that will make any piece of technology work better, maybe even miraculously so. Weapons do more damage, tools work faster and better, armor protects more strongly, vehicles move faster, and everything becomes tougher. What would you pay?

And in that moment where that boost of effectiveness might be the only thing that could save your life... what wouldn't you pay?

We refer heavily to material in Librum Enchantus, you may want a copy of that for reference. Also recommended, but not required, is a strong sense of the difference between right and wrong, and the ability to see when something is just too good to be true...

108171.name: Nostrum Arms 2016 Arms and Armor Catalog
108171.description:
From publisher blurb:


Mechanical Advantage

Welcome to the Nostrum Arms 2016 Catalog. Here, you'll find our new generation of Personal Powered Armor, and the weaponry and accessories that make it among the most effective weapon systems on the battlefield today.

Learn how to take one soldier, and multiply his effectiveness by a factor of ten or more!
Our Integrated Armor System (IAS) allows for the maximum maneuverability with the maximum armor protection. Walk through a hail of gunfire without blinking, and use our advanced particle beam weaponry to make the gunfire stop - permanently!

We have units with integrated flight systems, units with integrated heavy weaponry, and the ability to accessorize your powered armor to suit your individual needs.

With full life support and a twenty-four hour battery life,* you'll have mastery of the field of battle like never before. With spare batteries and our patented high-speed chargers, keep your troops in a rotation of constant effectiveness, in full communication with command!

It's a new world, out there. Isn't it about time you got the new weapons of war to help you conquer it - before your opposition does?


Your Mileage May Vary.


Includes information about the Nostrum Arms company, their top-selling product lines, and additional game world information to integrate these wonders of modern technology into your Hot Chicks Game.

108172.name: Psi Hacker
108172.description:
From publisher blurb:


Not The Average Villain

Her name is Jamaica Simone, and she will ruin your life and make you thank her for the privelege. A rogue agent of the mysterious organizaiton of psionics known as Project Demna, Jamaica wrote the manuals on dealing with blackmail and extortion, then left for more profitable enterprises.

You don't have to worry about bullets or knives around Jamaica - but make one wrong move, and she'll own you, body and soul. By the time she's done with you, you'll wish the bullets and knives were back...

Meet Jamaica Simone and see her methods of ruining people's lives for fun and profit
Meet Jamaica's apprentice Lynsey Grun, and see how dangerous the world of psionic blakmail and extortion can get
Meet Morgan Ramses, agent of Demna and someone with the ridiculously hard job of tracking down Jamaica Simone and bringing her in, dead or alive
New Psionic Disciplines of all kinds
Psionic Pharmaceuticals to grant awesome powers of the mind, for a price!
Equipment for working with, and dealing with, those with Psionic abilties!




Get ready to join the hunt for the Psi Hacker, or turn the tables and help her against the lethal skills of Demna's best. Gain tremendous new powers for life, or drop a pill and gain them for an hour or so. Just remember to read ALL the side effects, first...

108173.name: Rampage of the Ebon Fur
108173.description:
From publisher blurb:


BEWARE THE EBON FUR!

Once, Nrak was a simple Furry - a spiritual warrior in the battle for the soul of mankind. When he was captured and tortured by his racial enemies, the Slimeys, he thought he would surely die in their grasp.

What happened was so much worse than he could have imagined - in defeating the Slimeys in a battle of wills, he became something no longer Furry and not quite Slimey - he became the Ebon Fur, a being of nearly unlimited potential and an equally unlimited craving for the fear, pain, and death of any sentient creature he could get his paws (and/or tentacles) on!

This refers heavily to material in our supplements Inner Darkness and Yiffy, Yaoi, and Yahooey!, which will also come in very useful.

Included is information about the Ebon Fur, his plans, and his depraved plan for Furries, Slimeys, and anyone he can get his manipulative appendages on. This book plumbs the depths to which a sentient mind can sink when it becomes addicted to inflicting pain, fear, and death - readers should be warned that it contains highly explicit and objectionable materials.

108174.name: Ten Uses for Incomplete Clones
108174.description:
From publisher blurb:


Life Is Cheap...

...and we're passing the savings on to you! Genetically engineered humans and clones can be very expensive items, and there are always people complaining about how ethical it may be to use them for dangerous tasks, or even to sell them at all!

But now, with stable clones removed from their cloning tanks at a point where they are viable, but not yet complete, we can eliminate many of the more expensive parts of the procedure. No longer will you be spending a hundred thousand or even fifty thousand dollars on your artificially grown life form - you can have one of these very useful and practical Incomplete Clones for around five thousand dollars!

Want them trained to do menial tasks? That's not a problem... for a little extra, we can program them with a wide variety of skills for all sorts of tasks. To tell you the truth, you may even find a few programs on the black market to teach these clones some skills that some people would find questionable, distasteful, or patently dangerous. We're not here to judge you, though... we just want to sell you some Incomplete Clones for all of your needs!

Sure, they're not much to look at, they can't handle direct sunlight, and they have a very limited lifespan, but that's part of the beauty of it! We're sure that you'll be able to find some uses for these clones that will more than pay for them in the time that you'll have them - and they're easy to replace!

We'll even come and pick them up from you when they expire... no matter what they expire from, no questions asked. We're not going to tell you what not to do with your own property, after all!

So, are you ready to own some of that cheap life that everyone's been talking about? We offer volume discounts and free shipping on large orders. Who could possibly object to that?

108176.name: Over Under Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 11 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Travel Games
108176.description:
The Over Under Game takes the well-known over/under terminology from sports betting and applies it to the world of trivia, with all players or teams trying to be the first to reach the finish line.

Players can compete individually or in up to four teams. On a turn, one member of the active team rolls a die, then either moves that team's pawn forward or backward two spaces or presents a trivia statement in one of four categories – Fun Food Facts, Numerical Nuggets, Amazing Physical Phenoms and Wacky, Warped & Weird – to all of the other teams, along with a "line". For example: "Over under on the number of times a male lion mates each day. Line: 20".

All other teams secretly choose an Over or Under token with a value from 1 to 5, then they reveal these tokens simultaneously. If a team guessed Over or Under correctly, it moves ahead the bid number of spaces on the playing track; if wrong, it moves backwards. The next team then rolls the die.

The first team to land on the finish line by exact count wins.

108177.name: The Breeding Time
108177.description:
From publisher blurb:


What Could Go Wrong?

An invitation to a charity Lingerie party at a night club out in the middle of nowhere seemed like a great chance to get in some social networking, have some free drinks and food, and spend some time around lovely ladies in lacy things.

When terrorists attack the party with the intent to rob the place blind, it seems like the night might just turn into an adventurer's perfect trifecta - a party, a fight, and a victory celebration all at the same time.

It's not going to go that smoothly, though... not only are these terrorists good at what they do, there is also a problem in the basement... a lot of problems in the basement. A lot of problems with sharp teeth, massive claws, and a desire to kill and breed.

When the night club locks down tighter than any night club should, and the mixture of player characters, gun-toting terrorists, and monsters kicks into full swing, it's time to see just how bad a situation can get.

108178.name: The Cyber-Undead
108178.description:
From publisher blurb:


Never Say "Goodbye!"

People say you can't avoid two things - Death, and Taxes. Well, we can't do anything about Taxes, but here at the Lazarus Corporation, we've finally got an answer to Death. Not just for the rich, either... but for everyone!

No longer do you have to pay one or two million dollars for the luxury of a Full Cyborg Replacement Body. You can now have your brain placed in the Lazarus Cyborg Body for just over $200,000.00 - a procedure covered by most major medical insurance companies. We'll even do the paperwork for you, and arrange easy and affordable financing!

The Lazarus Cyborg Body features self-repair technology that borders on miraculous; lose an eye or a limb? It rebuilds itself while you wait! Stop worrying about the little troubles of life such as suffocation, hunger*, thirst, disease, and poisons - finally, you can live on in a stronger, faster, more durable body.

108179.name: The Last Ghost Hunt
108179.description:
From publisher blurb:


So You Want To Hunt Ghosts?


In the Reality Television packed media of the Earth in the year 2015, there are a lot of opportunities for some enterprising young people to make money. The supernatural investigation show can be very appealing for those who like to travel and shout at ghosts.

No one is better at this than the Ghost Annoyers, and they only need to get one more show out this season.

Unfortunately, in the world of Hot Chicks, the ghosts might just be more real than you want to deal with. Follow the story of the Ghost Annoyers' worst night ever as they finally find what they've been looking for all along... and it finds them.

Even if they survive the attention of these ancient evil sadists, they might just be releasing one of the most gruesome terrors to ever be imprisoned within the Earth... or they might just be hastening the destruction of the very Earth itself.

108180.name: The Lich Lord of Bakersfield!
108180.description:
From publisher blurb:


Such a Deal!

Welcome to scenic Bakersfield, a small town in a state near you. Enjoy the booming local economy, the quaint shops, the friendly people, and the great pie!

And, if you know what you're looking for, enjoy the astonishing deals on magic items of all kinds.

A few words of warning, though...

Don't go outside after 8:00 PM. The folk in Bakersfield like to get a good night's sleep.

Don't go looking for the town's master Enchanter - he kind of likes his privacy, if you know what we mean.

Oh, and try not to be too exceptional. Exceptional people dissapear, every so often. Just up and vanish.

Did we mention that you shouldn't go looking for the town's master Enchanter?

'Cause he might be lookin' for you...

108181.name: Vampire Sex Robot!
108181.description:
From publisher blurb:


Her Name is Lillith

Lillith X-01, to be more precise. She's an experiment in sex and horror - a psychological weapon of mass destruction, designed to turn a city inside-out with a fear that they dare not speak about aloud.

When people start turning up dead, their every drop of blood drained out, and having apparently died in the act of having the most pleasure they have ever experienced, no one wants to say what everyone is thinking. "Vampire." People start stocking up on garlic and crosses, though, and making sure to not invite anyone they don't know in to their homes.

Lillith finds it all amusing, and plays the part of the mysterious Vampire perfectly; just waiting for the moment someone discovers that you can't kill a super-tough combat-hardened robot by driving a stake through it's heart...

This Adventure is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game. It contains details about the creation and operation of Lillith X-01, and what she is doing to the poor city that she has elected to inhabit. Also included is an extensive gallery of images for use as game reference, and because we really like making picture of Lillith.

Take your Hot Chicks campaign to a dark place in beauty and style!

108182.name: When Hot Chicks BLOW STUFF UP!
108182.description:
From publisher blurb:


BOOM, BABY!

Sometimes, you need to blow stuff up. Here we discuss the process in detail, from the history of explosive compounds (real and fictional) to the construction of explosive devices and what happens when you set them off. When it's time to strike a decisive blow for the future and destiny of mankind, it might just be time to BLOW SOMETHING UP!

Not only are some of the most common (and less common) types of known explosives included, but we've thrown in a few alchemical, magical, alien, and High Tech explosives to keep things interesting. You never know when you'll need explosives that generate psionic damage, or a bomb that will not only take out a building in bright green fire, but will make the resulting crater smell like pretty flowers (forever)!

Includes rules for making and disarming bombs of all kinds, improvising explosives and including them (with caution and precision) in your Hot Chicks campaign. Also includes new equipment, new Cyberware, new Magic Spells, and new Psionic Disciplines for making it easier to deal with explosives... or harder, depending on your point of view.

Also included are some NPCs to bring explosive nightmares into your game - the Demolition Thrall and the Plastique Golem. Yes, it's a hundred pounds of Semtex that can walk up to you and ask for a hug!

In a world where Aliens, Demons, and human greed are bearing down on you with the intent to turn you into food, product, or worse, sometimes you need to bring out a little somthing extra.... and that's When Hot Chicks BLOW STUFF UP!

108183.name: Wishtaker Companion
108183.description:
From publisher blurb:


All of This and Brains, Too!

In Wishtaker, we introduced you to a new face in the world of Hot Chicks; born of a disastrous meeting between forces of Villain-Net and the Slimeys from Yiffy, Yaoi, and Yahooey!, the Wishtaker was something beyond the pale.

Now, in the Wishtaker Companion, we provide you with the full size images of all of the graphics in the Wishtaker book, along with over a dozen new images of the Wishtaker and her horrific operations.

Accompanying the full-size graphics are pages of notes on the Wishtaker, what her place in the Universe actually is, and exactly what her presence means for your Hot Chicks campaign. Be warned - she may be too hot (and/or too dangerous!) to handle!

Also included is the origin of the Wishtaker's twisted minions, the Pain Sisters, and their game statistics... because one evil sexy robot deserves another.

108184.name: The Hot Chicks Art Book 3: The Art of Naked Distress
108184.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Hot Chicks 3.1: Naked Distress, you saw women of unigue strength and beauty in a disadvantaged state; defenseless and very, very worried. The 48 unique 25mm paper miniatures can now be seen as full-sized graphics in "The Hot Chicks Art Book 3: The Art of Naked Distress!"

Useful as character illustrations and visual aids, these high-quality graphics give you the full detail of these figures in full color. Includes Bonus Material, with our analysis of "What could Worry Hot Chicks that much" and "How can you tell if she's a Cyborg?"

The perfect complement to Hot Chicks Artbook 2: The Art of Dangerous Curves, this book shows you the full depth of our women of unique beauty and strength; the yin to their yang. Enjoy the full depth of these characters, with full-sized graphics.

Want to get closer to Hot Chicks? Then you need "The Hot Chicks Artbook 3: The Art of Naked Distress!"

108185.name: The Hot Chicks Art Book 4: The Art of Ladies of the Night
108185.description:
From publisher blurb:

In our Standee set Hot Chicks 4: Ladies of the Night, you met 48 women of smouldering beauty, ready to entice men to their doom and ruin. There, they were scaled to 25mm. Now, see the full-sized graphics of the women of Ladies of the Night.

Ideal as a reference book, this tome provides chracter sketches for players and GMs alike, as well as providing commentary on the nature of the characters portrayed, personalities, and possible uses of the figures in Roleplaying scenarios. Great for generating a quick bit of color for a campaign, as well as getting story seeds.

Included in "Hot Chicks Artbook 4: The Art of Ladies of the Night" are several pages of bonus material with information on the different types of Ladies of the Night, and how to incorporate them into your Roleplaying experience!

If you're ready to have Ladies of the Night in YOUR Gaming Experience, you're ready for "The Hot Chicks Art Book 4: The Art of Ladies of the Night!"

108186.description:
The Rattus Bonus 2 (also known as Rattus: Essen 2011 Bonus Cards) contains 4 additional character cards:

Saladin (Chivalry)
Aladdin (Islamic)
Bedouin (Peasantry)
Sinbad (Islamic)




NOTE: Rattus (the base game) and the Rattus: Africanus expansion are required in order to play with these four new character cards. They can also be combined with the character cards from Rattus: Pied Piper and any other promotional character cards.
108186.name: Rattus: Spiel 2011 Bonus Cards

108187.name: Citadel of Pain
108187.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Beware the Mad Baron's Legacy!

Welcome to Rogthandor, a massive and crumbling fortress history has dubbed the Citadel of Pain. Years ago, Baronet Dumond imprisoned his citizens in the citadel, using them as test subjects for his twisted experiments. Dumond's ambition was to construct the ultimate torture device in the belief that by consuming the agony of others he could turn himself into a god.

In pursuit of this goal, he allowed his lands to become overrun by monsters and creatures out of nightmare, who soon became the citadel's new residents. During the Baronet's final days, an alchemical liquid poured from the tower of Rogthandor, sealing the keep and its residents inside a magic-resistant shell of stone.

Now, decades later, a powerful digging machine will carry a group of brave adventurers beyond the ivy-enshrouded walls and into the heart of Rothandor. Can your PCs survive the horrors trapped within the bastion and solve the mystery of the Citadel of Pain?

This Gaming Paper Adventure Includes:

-Uses the entire 7'x10' map contained in Gaming Paper Adventures: Mega-Dungeon 1.
-24 additional map sheets unique to this adventure that work with Gaming Paper Adventures: Mega-Dungeon 1.
-6 pages of illustrated handouts to immerse players in the Citadel of Pain.
-A Faction Tracker sheet to help GMs and players keep track of the shifting alliances among the groups they encounter.

Citadel of Pain is a massive adventure for 7th-level characters. This adventure is compatible with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and Gaming Paper Adventures: Mega-Dungeon 1.

108189.name: All Stars Take on the Mega Dungeon
108189.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Four amazing authors, four fantastic adventures!

Four of the RPG Industry's brightest stars have each written an adventure compatible with the Gaming Paper Adventures: Mega Dungeon 1.

Monte Cook's "Temple of the Half-Born" - Asked for help by a strange old man, you travel underneath a massive cemetery to investigate and root out the evil that lurks below. Delve deep into the temple to meet demons, hybrid ghouls, cadaverous projects gone wrong, and the mastermind behind it all. This is an adventure for 7th or 8th level characters.

Brian Cortijo's "Arena of Souls" - You've been abducted! Fight your way through the arena and find a way to escape. Beware! You start out weaponless and imprisoned. The tiefling priest warden is more than he seems; he is providing entertainment for perverse locals and the arena has an even more sinister purpose. Time for a jailbreak! An adventure for 3rd or 4th level characters.

Ed Greenwood's "Lost Coins and Flying Bones" - Many years ago a group of merchant traders met a very sticky end. Rumor have circulated for decades about the wealth and magic held within the traders' storage cellars below the city. You have learned the location of the only entrance to those cellars. What does it contain? Goods, wealth, magic? Will you live long enough to find out? An adventure for a 5th to 6th level party.

Steven Schend's "Keep Away From the Borderlands!" - It has been two nights since Corith's Watch, a holy night that occurs only once every 120 years. The full moon glowed blue and strange things happened. People have disappeared. Blue fires rage across the wilderness. Some people have not been heard from since that night, including the guards at the local watch post. You have been hired to investigate what happened at the keep! A first level adventure.

This adventure is compatible with the Pathfinder Role Playing Game and Gaming Paper Adventures: Mega-Dungeon 1.

108190.description:
Released in October 2011.

The bonus card 'The Mandarin' gives you the opportunity to play Lost Temple with even up to 9 players! It consists of the extra card 'Mandarin' (in 4 languages) as well as an extra pawn and card (brown) for a 9th player. The special ability of the Mandarin: move forward as many spaces as your rank in the race.
108190.name: Lost Temple: The Mandarin

108191.description:
Released in october 2011.

This free bonus contains 6 bonus tiles for Singapore (a Spiel 2011 release from White Goblin Games) for even more variation. It contains 4 buildings with legal activities and 2 with illegal activities.

Available through:
Essen 2011 Show: purchase of the Singapore in the White Goblin Games booth 5-01 in Hall 5 or as a pre-order at www.whitegoblingames.com/spiel
108191.name: Singapore: Essen 2011 bonus tiles

108192.description:
The Kingdom of Crusaders: Ordonnance expansion includes new cards of different types:


Unit cards with more powerful armies that have a pair of matching symbols on two lines.
New "Kingdom cards" that cancel a unit type at a location, probably upsetting the existing balance of power, in addition to changing the number of cards allowed at that location.
"Ordonnance" cards that allow players to draw extra cards from the deck, swap units at their locations, and even destroy their opponents units.


With the additional cards in Ordonnance, The Kingdom of Crusaders can now be played with up to four players, and the additional victory markers needed are included in this expansion.
108192.name: The Kingdom of Crusaders: Ordonnance

108193.description:
Elias Hooker had a bitter dispute during a Poker game in a saloon in Oklahoma, and was later arrested for the murder of Gus Armstrong during the most ferocious thunderstorm anybody could recall.

On April 19, 1885 a vigilante mob of over a hundred fifty men stormed the jail, and dragged out Elias, along with Jim Evans, Jesse Miller, and D.B. Nott. All four of them were hanged in an abandoned barn behind the jail.

Elias survived, against the odds, when he was cut down minutes after his short-drop attempted execution, by Deputy 'Clay' Beckwith - he and ten lawmen broke up the vigilante gathering. The records state that thirty men were arrested that moon-lit April night, but the records do not tell if the other prisoners survived.

After being taken to Surgeon's Hall, the authorities decided to reprieve Elias and his sentence was commuted to transportation for four years. While serving his sentence, Elias turned to the teachings of the Good Book for guidance - returning to Repentance Springs a changed man. Soon, he found that his gunfighting and horse-handling skills had attracted the recognition of Ned McReady, who gave the man a badge.

When Jack Colty rained bullets about town, Elias was one of the first to ride with Ned. The rest is history...
108193.name: Revolver: Elias Hooker Promo Card

108194.description:
Originally from Ireland, Brady Logan had a chequered career before finding himself a deputy at Repentance Springs - he joined the navy in 1856 aged 15 years and 9 months, and spent most of his early career aboard HMS 'Royal Adelaide'. He also spent three months of his service in diving bells in the Mediterranean.

The records show that he married on September 14th 1867 in St Senan's Church in Kilrush. It is not recorded if the couple had any children.

Brady was later discharged (referred to as a 'bad chicken dinner') from HMS Liverpool for reasons unstated, but guessed to be insobriety on duty.

After his wife died of 'The Shakes', Brady sobered up and travelled to America, visiting his sister and her mining engineer husband - both were employed by the Cottonwood Mining Company.

Brady worked at Rattlesnake Creek for a time, utilising his knowledge of rifles and explosives to make a few bucks - even completing a contract for Fort Murphy up at Lincoln County.

Colonel Ned McReady deputised Brady when the McSween brothers and gang kidnapped Jackie Peppin. During the gunfight at Peppin farm, on Sept 1st, 1891, Brady shot both brothers in the face at one hundred yards, and also 'Turkey' Joe in the buttocks. Ned is reported to have called Brady Logan 'The best shot with a rifle the Lord has ever seen."

Noted to have an eagle tattoo on his left forearm, from his service days, Brady also sports a small scar on his upper lip - he insists it was cut by an Apache knife, others whisper that it was from years of playing the Mouth Harp. Badly.

Married his second wife, Josie Hopkins, at St Ezekiel's Episcopal Church.

Was also once struck by lightning during the summer of 1890.
108194.name: Revolver: Brady Logan Promo Card

108195.name: Cycle Jump
108195.description:
From the 1978 Elektrik Keyboard catalog:

Your paddle is your throttle as you "wheelie" your motorcycle over bales of hay. Gun your throttle and jump over the trucks. If you land safely on the ramp, score one and add a truck.
